story:
Refugee Art Project is a non-profit community art organization that supports the art and self-expression of asylum seekers and refugees. We have conducted weekly art workshops with people in the Villawood detention centre and with refugee women in Parramatta over the last year, from which we will soon hold a new exhibition, called Still Alive, at the Stanley Street Gallery in Sydney. 

This campaign is to raise the money to bring Thomas Wales*, an Aboriginal elder, traditional landowner and spokesperson for the Thanakwith people in far north Queensland, down to Sydney so that he can be a part of our art exhibition, and so that we can film a short documentary about him. 

Thomas worked as a security guard in the remote Sherger detention centre in far north Queensland, and became close friends with the young Afghan refugees who were held there. He treated them with respect and supported them emotionally. When they left the centre he rescued and preserved some of their artworks which were left behind, and which he sent to us for the exhibition. The works provide important reflections on the lives and experiences of the young Afghan refugees who were kept at Sherger. We would like to bring Thomas to Sydney so that he can address a Sydney audience, and we can make a short video documentary, about his experiences of working in the detention centre, what the artworks mean to him and the friendships that he made.     

We are asking for $2000 to cover the cost of Thomas' flight tickets and accommodation expenses in Sydney for one week. Anything over that will go towards the costs of filming our short documentary about Thomas and his experiences. They will contribute to the basic costs of camera and equipment hire plus sound and film editing.  

We have some exciting gifts and perks for people who donate so do check out the side bar!

This film will illustrate the emotional solidarity of a compassionate Aboriginal elder towards the asylum seekers and refugees that he met during his time as a security guard at Sherger. This is a man who refused to refer to refugees by their boat number but called them by their names. He is proud of the fact that he and his indigenous colleagues treated the refugees with friendship, kindness and respect. This will be a very special visit and a wonderful short documentary! 

Details for the Still Alive exhibition in Sydney can be seen here. 

*Appendum, in the video Safdar Ahmed accidentally referred to Thomas Wales as Thomas White.

story:
*Update*

Blank Space will be collaborating with Imagine a show (http://imagineashow.com/site/) to bring both youth photography and emerging arts to Waterloo! Our new location will be in the Shops at Waterloo Town Square, Unit31B. More details to follow soon! 

Short Summary

Blank Space Gallery is a brand new independent nonprofit gallery in Uptown Waterloo that will showcase emerging artists from Waterloo Region and surrounding areas. 

  • Two to three artists will be showcased every month
  • All proceeds from sales go directly to the artist
  • Artists gain valuable exhibition experience and exposure
After graduating with a degree in Fine Arts, many artists set their sights on applying for exhibitions, residencies, and work in the creative field. As a young artist, it can be hard to successfully get your work shown, let alone sell pieces. This is the motivation behind Blank Space.

What We Need & What You Get

By supporting this initiative, you'll be helping to promote the talented young artists in your region. Where your money will go:

  • Hardware and installation expenses (tools, installation equipment, hardware for hanging paintings, plinths for sculptural objects, easels, frames etc)
  • White panelling for behind the artworks
  • Promotion and signage (both in and out of the gallery)
  • If we raise extra money: we would love to be able to host opening night receptions for each time we install a new artist!
1 Original painting by Jess Stickel available:

15 limited edition prints available. 'The Third Insight' by Vickie Vainionpaa:


The Impact

This project is a valuable part of growing the arts community in Waterloo Region and bringing emerging talent to the forefront.

  • Buying local art is an important way that communities can support artists
  • As opposed to commercial galleries, artist-run nonprofits like Blank Space provide a more open and experimental place to showcase contemporary art
  • Blank Space will bring Uptown Waterloo a new way of engaging with arts in the community

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we still value your help!

  • Get the word out and tell your friends about this campaign
  • Spread the word to young professional artists you know to apply for our very first showcase! blankspacewaterloo@gmail.com

story:
''The world was said to be rectangular, then it was said to be round but in the end it will be said to be triangular.'' Murat Saygıner

What is UniPrism ?

UniPrism is a 3D web browser application in which you can explore the internet within virtual spaces. A place in which you can interact with other users as well as your environment using your desktop computer, your tablet and your smart phone.

How Does it Work ?

Each user is given a free profile and a 3D character which they can edit to suit their identity. Then they can travel through several rooms designed with 3D computer software. Every room has its own purpose and theme. As a user you will be able to visit or host exhibitions, listen to music, watch videos and browse libraries.

Is there any example ?

Yes you can enter www.uniprism.com in order to visit an example space. Beware that this is only a showcase to illustrate how the application works. The project's full potential can only be achieved with your support.

What is the aim of the project ?

- To promote art by creating a space where artists can hold exhibitions.

- To integrate the application for mobile.

- To unify all social media and website accounts into one and only profile. A collaboration between Google, Facebook, Youtube, Twitter, Soundcloud, Vimeo, Wikipedia and many others will help in the expansion of the project. As each of them will have their own tool within the user interface of the 3D browser. Users will be able to chat within the virtual space.

- To be able to create a space where companies, brands, artists and public figures can advertise by creating their own rooms, stands and billboards within the museum.

- To collaborate with a virtual reality headset company such as the Oculus Rift in order to enhance the experience.

All received funds will be used to gather programmers and visual artists. With a proper team we will be able to build the first steps of the project.

Why choose UniPrism ?

Are you an artist willing to share your work without having to deal with a gallery ?

Are you tired of not being able to afford an exhibition budget ?

Are you willing to reach an international audience rather than a city ?

Do you want complete control over the presentation of your show ?

If the answer is yes than The UniPrism can be your host.

- An unlimited exhibition space that fits its purpose according to the artist's desire.

- International visitors who can meet and discuss about the works.

- A growing audience of the museum with each exhibition.

- No travelling for the visitor. No entry fee.

- No costs for printing, hanging works.

- Open every day and every hour.

- The artists can attend their own exhibition to give a speech.

''I see no vision of oneness in the current network of social services. We can all collaborate in order to integrate these tools into the user interface of a new browser. I believe this generation that has grown up with video games is ready to experience a new way of surfing the web. We are entering a new era and this is the future of internet browsing. 3D browsing has endless potential and I say we build it together. Let's build a home without borders, for all inhabitants of Earth. An enormous museum dedicated to the human kind. A temple with an art gallery, a university, a library, a shopping mall, all in one place, a place where we can unite, discover, express, communicate and share. The more support we have from you the more the project will be able to expand.''

MURAT SAYGINER

About the creator :

Murat Saygıner is a visionary artist who works in the fields of art photography and computer graphics, and is also known as a digital artist, filmmaker and composer.

Born in Prague in 1989, Murat Saygıner studied in Paris during his childhood and graduated from Lycee Charles De Gaulle high school in Ankara. He got involved with photography in 2007 and won several international awards. In 2008 his works were selected for ''IPA BEST OF SHOW'' exhibition in New York. In 2010 he was awarded Emerging Talent of the Year in the Worldwide Photography Gala Awards. He published his first short film ''Ratio'' in 2013, his second film ''Volans'' and his third film ''Zodiac - Evolution'' in 2014.

Website : http://www.muratsayginer.com

Facebook Page : http://www.facebook.com/muratsayginerpage

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nia King and I am a queer mixed-race art activist. I use zines, comics, short films, and most recently, a podcast to share the stories of queer and trans people of color. I have been running my podcast, We Want the Airwaves, since March 2013. On each episode, I interview a different queer or trans artist of color about their life and work. This month, I published my 33rd episode, featuring the brilliant Mimi Thi Nguyen (pictured above)!

One of the things that is unique about my podcast is that I have every episode transcribed to make it accessible for deaf audiences. I make all the transcripts available for free, but it costs me $50 an episode to have the podcast transcribed. Since August 2013, I have been working with co-editors Jessica Glennon-Zukoff and Terra Mikalson to turn some of the early transcriptions into a book. I am asking you to donate today so I can continue to make transcriptions available and keep the podcast deaf-accessible, and also so I can throw a launch party for the book in the fall.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The first $300 will go towards having the rest of this year's episodes transcribed.
  • The next $300 will go towards towards a launch party for my forthcoming book (paying for space rental, food, and performer stipends).
  • The last $150 will be used to cover the cost of making and shipping perks, and the cost of indiegogo fees.

The Impact

The mainstream media allows very few queer and trans people of color to tell their stories. My work is creating an alternative archive that documents the life-changing work of queer and trans artists of color, and enables their legacies to be shared across time and space.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends through  Facebook, Twitter, and Tumblr. Thanks for taking the time to read this. <3

story:
My name is Chuck Olson and I have been a painter and university professor for over 40 years. My work is included in important museum collections such as the Carnegie Museum of Art (Pittsburgh) and the Osaka Museum of Modern Art in addition to many museum. university, corporate , and private collections, In 2013, I was honored by the city of Pittsburgh with the title of Master Visual Artist as part of their Legacy Program. In addition, I have staged exhibitions across the United States as well as in France, Italy, Germany, and Japan. 

This campaign has powerful importance to me as it arrives at the beginning of my post university life which finds me wanting to engage in new, vital work that I can also share with public institutions via the contemporary print. Our hospitals, schools and libraries struggle with their budgets and are woefully positioned to acquire fine art that will bring new energy to the atmosphere of their respective institutions. To donate original, one of a kind paintings is problematic whereas the gift of the edition print allows me to donate a portion of the work to several causes. It has long been my mantra to seek to design projects wherein everyone "wins". 

Contributors to this cause will have the opportunity to directly own my original prints and to have the satisfaction in knowing that this ownership has led to the work being gifted to public institutions. 

The costs of doing large scale, multicolor lithographs are high. In order to realize 2 unique images of editions of 80 prints(36x45) each the following is required: 200 sheets of the highest quality paper ($15/sheet), 70 color plates and ink for the hand made separations ($100 each separation), printer's fees, shipping/handling of the work, and travel costs between Pittsburgh and Amarillo, Texas. With a successful funding campaign, the two images will be made in August and September of 2017. 

Perks and incentives have been designed to stimulate the funding of this project. They include the opportunity to purchase signed 11x17 images of one or more of the first three prints of this series made by the artist at the Raburn Studio, a signed copy of "Chuck Olson : Visual Histories" 116 full color hardbound book of the artist's work, the purchase of an original, signed and framed painted collage (9x11) by the artist, and/or the purchase of  1 or more original lithographs from the series of 5 (or the entire series of 5). In addition, Chuck Olson is available to present a lecture/critique, to give a tour of "Chuck Olson's Gettysburg" by arrangement at Gettysburg, PA to your group, to hire the band (of which he is a part )THE SIX for your corporate or private event, or to engage for the entire sponsorship of $22,000 in a privately agreed contract involving original paintings, prints, and/or  lectures.

If the full amount is not realized within the 8 week campaign, prints will still be made but perhaps not on the same scale, edition number, or number of color separations.

This project is designed to benefit all: the contributor, the public domain, and the legacy of the artist. Hopefully, the success of this will set forth a "way of working" with successive yearly projects designed to build upon this legacy. As an art educator, I have had greats success in mainstreaming the idea of visual art in life and this affords me a new opportunity to continue that tradition in a unique way.

I have worked very successfully with the Michael Raburn Studio in 2015-2016 and look forward to a very productive partnership in designing and printing the two new images. His operation is one of the best in the United States. The challenge is simply to realize the $22,000 required to do the work- a sum that is difficult to acquire by means other that crowd funding. The solution is via these important perks and incentives and the enthusiasm it generates.

If you cannot make a contribution yourself, I ask that you please forward this project idea along to others. If you decide to engage in active support by contributing for 1 or more of the incentives, please also pass the word along as well. I would like the creating and the giving in this to become a tradition.

Here is the picture gallery of perks and incentives to help support the project. You will find the details to each incentive in the Perks Section of this document ... and thank you for your time and consideration!

"Evening Star" : 36x48 Multicolored Lithograph in edition of 80

 

Heroic Age/Pawn 36x45 Multicolored Lithograph in edition of 80

Pour le Merite : Multicolored Lithograph in edition of 80

These prints are available as follows: from $25 (11x17 digital print) or $500 for an edition numbered print (36x45) or the full series of 5 (36x45) for $2000. This offer is through August 4, 2017 exclusively. The retail value of the edition prints is $1000 each.

$50 for The Book: Chuck Olson: Visual Histories

$250: 11"x9" Personal Painted Collage(framed)

$500: Olson Lecture/Critique

$100 per person/6 minimum: Chuck Olson's Gettysburg!

$4000: THE SIX: Private 2 1/2 hour Concert 

$22,000: FULL SPONSORSHIP with Private Agreement on acquiring Paintings and Prints

story:
the World needs ART.  art needs YOU.
Join the Artivist Movement to provide access to Creativity, Collaboration & Community for Artivists in Boulder, Denver & beyond.

ar·tiv·ist: A person who changes the world by penetrating the collective consciousness through art and collaboration.

ART awakens our empathy.

ART as ACTION’s collaborative creative process inspires artists of all ages and experience levels to explore, express and embrace their humanity and the humanity of others.

YOUR donation helps to cover rental fees for studio and performance spaces where this process happens.

Humans heal and are healed through the service of ART and creativity.

ART as ACTION nurtures & cultivates a wide range of Artivists including:

  • People with Parkinson's Disease who uncover their inner dancer through our Reconnect with your Body classes
  • At-risk youth finding a safe space to explore their place in the world through our Young Artivists Performance Lab program at Attention Homes Runaway and Homeless Youth Shelter
  • Veteran performers, both experimenting with new genres and embracing their primary art form
  • Closet artists just discovering their creative potential through our Artivist Process

YOUR donation helps us provide these services for little or no cost to the participants.

ART helps us understand that which is bigger than ourselves.

ART as ACTION provides participants and audience members the opportunity to reflect on ourselves and explore the common feelings and experiences we all share.  Our programs and performances provide a place to discover unexpected connections and stop feeling so small and isolated that we stop contributing what is unique about us.  We embolden the distinct, rare creativity deep within each individual.

YOUR donation helps us compensate the human-power it takes to make our programs and performances successful.

the World needs ART.  art needs YOU.
Join the Artivist Movement and become an integral part of Art as Action.
DONATE!
Join in the communal, universal, healing language of music, of dance, of poetry – of ART!

EXPERIENCE ARTIVISM:

  • Witness our annual performance, both/and, December 5 & 6 at The Dairy Center for the Arts in Boulder, Colorado.  both/and is an exploration of dichotomies - instead of fixating on either/or, black/white - embracing the gray of our existence and making peace with uncertainty. both/and will be a brand new original work, our 12th performance created through the Artivist Process.
  • Attend Reconnect with your Body dance class, on Wednesday nights, 7:30-8:30pm at Apex Community Center in Arvada, Colorado. These classes explore the power of dance, creativity and artistic expression and enable participants to discover new ways to move their bodies. Dance has the power to transform and heal – plus it’s fun!  Beneficial for all bodies, including people with Parkinson’s Disease and Multiple Sclerosis.  COME DANCE WITH US!

#theworldneedsART

www.artasaction.org

WEAR YOUR ARTIVISM - Presenting our new T-Shirt, especially created for those of you who believe “the world needs art, art needs you." A $50 donation means you get this one of a kind shirt! (Next Level brand premium shirt, 100% Combed Cotton Jersey)
story_txt:
the World needs ART. 
art needs YOU.
Join the Artivist Movement to provide access to Creativity,
Collaboration & Community for Artivists in Boulder, Denver & beyond.

ar·tiv·ist: A person who changes the
world by penetrating the collective consciousness through art and
collaboration.
ART awakens our
empathy.
ART as ACTION’s collaborative creative process inspires
artists of all ages and experience levels to explore, express and embrace their
humanity and the humanity of others.
YOUR donation helps to
cover rental fees for studio and performance spaces where this process happens.
Humans heal and
are healed through the service of ART and creativity.
ART as ACTION nurtures & cultivates a wide range of
Artivists including: 

People with Parkinson's Disease who uncover
their inner dancer through our Reconnect
with your Body classes
At-risk youth finding a safe space to explore
their place in the world through our Young
Artivists Performance Lab program at Attention Homes Runaway and Homeless
Youth Shelter
Veteran performers, both experimenting with new
genres and embracing their primary art form
Closet artists just discovering their creative
potential through our Artivist Process

YOUR donation helps us
provide these services for little or no cost to the participants.
ART helps us
understand that which is bigger than ourselves.
ART as ACTION provides participants and audience members the
opportunity to reflect on ourselves and explore the common feelings and
experiences we all share.  Our programs
and performances provide a place to discover unexpected connections and stop
feeling so small and isolated that we stop contributing what is unique about
us.  We embolden the distinct, rare
creativity deep within each individual.
YOUR donation helps us
compensate the human-power it takes to make our programs and performances successful.
 
the World needs ART. 
art needs YOU.Join the Artivist Movement and become an integral part
of Art as Action.
DONATE!
Join in the communal, universal, healing language of
music, of dance, of poetry – of ART!


EXPERIENCE ARTIVISM:


Witness our annual performance, both/and, December 5 & 6 at The Dairy Center for the Arts in
Boulder, Colorado.  both/and is an exploration of dichotomies
- instead of fixating on either/or, black/white - embracing the gray of our
existence and making peace with uncertainty. both/and will be a brand new
original work, our 12th performance created through the Artivist Process.

Attend Reconnect with your Body dance class, on Wednesday nights, 7:30-8:30pm at Apex Community Center in Arvada, Colorado.  These
classes explore the power of dance, creativity and artistic expression and
enable participants to discover new ways to move their bodies. Dance has the
power to transform and heal – plus it’s fun!  Beneficial for all bodies, including people
with Parkinson’s Disease and Multiple Sclerosis.  COME DANCE WITH US!
#theworldneedsARTwww.artasaction.org
WEAR YOUR ARTIVISM - Presenting our new T-Shirt, especially created for those of you who believe “the world needs art, art needs you." A $50 donation means you get this one of a kind shirt! (Next Level brand premium shirt, 100% Combed Cotton Jersey)

story:
UPDATE as of June 10, 2016: 

DECKS ARE DUE TO ARRIVE IN RICHMOND MONDAY JUNE 12th, 2016. SHIPPING WILL BEGIN IMMEDIATELY AND UPDATES WILL BE POSTED HERE. 

Now that the campaign is complete, you can visit us at www.hardestworkingwomaninshowbusiness.com/tarot... email us at futureoftradition@gmail.com to ORDER yours. 


World Spirit Who What?

I'm Lauren 'Onça' O'Leary and I want to re-publish my now out-of-print deck and book, the World Spirit Tarot. 

In about 1992 I decided to learn to read Tarot, and opted for the most immersive approach possible, researching and CREATING a Tarot deck of 79 unique 6" x 9" block-printed images. Seven years of intensive study of the centuries-old traditions, drawing, hand-carving and illuminating finally culminated in the World Spirit Tarot,  published by Llewellyn in 2001. My study-partner Jessica Godino and I co-wrote the accompanying 160 page book, which has received excellent reviews as a well-written, handy guide, making the tarot easy to understand and fun to explore. The WST was declared 'An instant classic' upon publication, and has been translated into Spanish!

My original mission was to make an accessible, multi-cultural and eclectic deck steeped in tradition but reflective of the real people in our lives - big, small, skinny, young, old, black, white and even blue.  It was well-received by the community, being described as the "Rider-Waite-Smith for modern times". Now the World Spirit Tarot is out of print, and hard to find for less than $140. (By the way, the posh $140 price-tag only benefits the dealers: Jess and I see no part of that.) 

So that's me, and the project. I've been asked many times by fans of the WST to reprint it. Now, at last, I can make this dream a reality. Llewellyn has graciously permitted me to reprint the original work. With the power of crowd-funding, you can pre-order decks and enjoy exciting perks, which helps gets the work out into the world, and offsets the financial risk to me in a tremendous project of this scale.

Pre-Order Your Deck, Get Goodies

$8500 is needed to cover the printing, lay-out, and shipping on the 1000 deck minimum order. The newly released decks will be $40; that's $100 less than on amazon.com. I have to sell about 220 decks to get this project out of debt. 

In addition to the WST itself, I have perks suitable for every budget. That includes tarot readings and online lessons with me (a rarity), a limited number of ORIGINAL PRINTS of the 2001 edition, goody bags, and for the  Serious Benefactor and in a long-standing tradition of art patronage, I can put your face or totem IN ONE OF THE CARDS. 

Thank you for helping bring this project back to the light!

    Why Help?

    Many of you over the years have reached out about loving this deck. You've shared that it has played a positive role in making pivotal life choices, and how seeing real 'normal' people portrayed as rich with aesthetic and symbolic meaning has empowered you. There was a groundswell of support for the deck when it was voted in the top ten decks of 2001, 2002, 2004, 2005 by the readers of Aeclectic Tarot community. But, I was not in a place in my life back then to really get the message out onto the world.  It's been 13 years, I'm a teacher, healer and mother now, and my life's work has BECOME the message m tarot brought me to: everyone should be free to seize their lives an choices and make magic and meaning from them.

      Risks & Challenges

      The hard part: I need to sell about 220 to get out debt on this. It will take about $8500 to get the WST reprinted and in the hands of the folks who love it. I'm a woman entrepreneur, making my living in the arts, so that's a lot of cash outlay.

      The great part: I've got a reputable printing house lined up to do the work, a wonderful studio full of supplies, archives of the original artwork, and a broad base of support built on these intervening years as a teacher, healer, and entertainer. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you don't want a deck, or yet more tarot art in your life, consider buying one for a friend. Maybe it will be that lifeline they need when confronted with a big life choice, or a fun gift for a special occasion for someone who needs to be reminded to take care of themselves!

      Please SPREAD the word about this limited edition re-issue, and the perks I'm offering to our supporters. Or just donate a few bucks so we can send you a hammy postcard and celebrate together when this giant undertaking is accomplished. 

      I thank you on behalf of everything World Spirit!

story:
Meet the Starlight Dragon Tarot, a deck of 78 mesmerizing images inspired by dragons –  the vision of Steph Engert and Nora Huszka. Open this treasure box abounding in rich artworks, poems and inspiration – our innovative tarot set, to enrich your life and magickal work.

Allow yourself to be carried away by 78 dragons in brilliant, visionary images. Follow this invitation to their lands of mystery, imagination and creativity - never seen like that before! Accept their guidance, their challenges and ancient wisdom and grow as a person and a tarot reader....

Get ready to be amazed!



Dragons are present in all ages and cultures as mighty awe-inspiring and fascinating mythic beings, human guides and companions. We captured their mystique, their creative energy in this unique deck.

Tarot,  the tool of magick and divination is the perfect “scene” for our dragons: a numinous place for encounters between dragon and human, a medium in which to unfold stories of fate and will, challenges and victory, redemption and, ultimately, growth... and coming back home.

See the outstanding special features which guide you through your readings without breaking the flow within the spread!


The cards have no borders. The dragon-scale like shape of squares "on tiptoe" make spreads easily grow from one card image-mandala to an ever greater image, seemingly endlessly.
Therefore, the labels on the cards are kept to the bare minimum- instead of titles we just have symbols for your orientation: Roman numerals and elemental or astrological symbols on the majors, Arabian numbers and the element sign on the minors.

The courts are also attributed to the elements so instead of Pages/Princesses, Knights/Princes, Queens and Kings we have Earth, Air, Water and Fire in their particular suits of Pentacles/Earth, Swords/Air, Cups/Water and Wands/Fire. 

A further feature of "navigating" the cards are the elemental rings formed of the quarter circles surrounding the numbers and symbols at top and bottom of the cards when they are layed out. At one glance you see how the energy flows between cards on your spread in the colours of golden for the majors, green for pentacles/earth, white for words/air, blue for cups/water and red for wands/fire.

Here is a basic spread of four cards from 3 elements and one Major kept together by the elemental ring showing that earth is missing in this spread.  You can interpret the cards in various ways: looking at the axes up-down, right-left, clockwise starting from the east (for example), viewing the four positions as those of the four directions and elements... or you can choose to use your own positions.

You also see various possibilities to extend the spread - adding cards in any direction.

The deck is almost finished - after more than a year of full time work to make it into the  master-piece we offer it to you to be among the first to get this unique deck imbued by the spirit of dragons and of high conceptual and artistic value! 

Now we have to take the final hurdle to bring it into the world: in return for the actual printing and production of the deck You will benefit from a lot of special, original perks!


TALISMANS & RINGS from the images are waiting to accompany you throughout the day with the power and protection of our dragons! These magickal accessoires   make a stunning extension for your outfit with their interesting feature: the magnifying glass finish. Beauty and quality guaranteed by Tannerson Company.


A CRYSTAL DRAGON SPELL for your protection and guidance. You will receive a sodalite crystal egg and a sigil charged with the spell.


T-SHIRTS, because these designs are real candy for your eye and they guarantee an extravagant look! We use only organic cotton and  fair trade material to give equally the best option for your body and our environment. So get your shirt on and embody your favorite card the whole day and night!


A SPECIALLY CRAFTED COURSE on dragon tarot magick, exclusive to supporters of this campaign get you on the fast track of working with this deck; our personal readings lead to the dragons' wise council for you.

THE BOOK: "Travelling with Starlight Dragons", written by Steph Engert is the ultimate guidance book for Tarot-Magick with the Starlight Dragon Tarot. It includes around 300 pages with colourful illustrations, wisdom and practice to make the most of your deck! Preface is written by the spellbinding Camelia Elias.

We need your support to make it happen, for this we are conducting this campaign to raise the printing costs in different stages:

8000€ = STAGE 1: UNLOCKED!

- We will print 1000x decks with a little white companion book

10 000€ = STAGE 2: UNLOCKED!

- We are going to print 1500x decks with gilded edges and a little white book

12 000€ = STAGE 3: UNLOCKED

- We are going to print 2000x decks, gilded edges and a little white companion book plus an extra card.

15 000€ = STAGE 4: LOCKED

-  12 extra FREE spreads and exercises are yours to become an expert reader with exclusive spreads invented by the creators of the deck and adaptations of classical spreads for the format of the Starlight Dragon, sent to you as a PDF file.

20 000€ STAGE 5: LOCKED

- HURRAY, your deck will be delivered with a FREE Starlight Dragon coloring book for adults! This creative booklet includes the 22 Major Arcana designs in black & white. As you go along and color them in,  you will experience how your imagination colors in the meaning and symbolism of the cards.

We also invite you to write a short poem accompanying the images to help deepening your meditation.


At the successful conclusion of this Indiegogo campaign, the Starlight Dragon Tarot deck goes straight into production!

We expect to have the decks and all the other goodies making up our perks ready for sending out in latest by August - beginning of September... and you, as our hero and supporter will be among the first ones to hold the deck in your hands!

The book, "Travelling with Starlight Dragons" will be shipped approximately by late September.

Stay tuned for news about the deck and our crowdfunding campaign here on our website, subscribe to our newsletter or follow us on Facebook !

story:
In 1987, David Bowie sang his prayer for Berlin, Heroes, so close to the Berlin Wall that people on the other side, divided from friends and family, cheered. It heralded the end of an era. Or so we thought.

Two decades later, new walls are going up - along the US border with Mexico, between Israel and Palestine and around “Fortress Europe.”

Stunned by the resilience of walls in political practice and people’s imaginations, Moving Matters Traveling Workshop will stage a workshop at a monument to the Berlin Wall on June 26-July 2, 2017.

What is the Moving Matters Traveling Workshop?

MMTW, for short, is an international art and research collective. All serial migrants, we present fine-grained views of migration as a complex life experience and source of inspiration. We dip into our own histories to collaborate with others who have experienced voluntary or involuntary displacement.

Our workshop is an interdisciplinary laboratory for explorations in art and research, a collaboration across cultures where we are both subject and object, all on an equal footing. We engage together in movement, the baby steps of migration, blurring the borders between artist, scholar and audience to create a synergy that imagines what is possible in the world.

We are inspired by specific locations to which we travel to hold our creative gatherings. We tailor our ideas, works and performances to each and every site or city where we appear. In Berlin we will present an exhibition, and live performances on the theme of “Walls” - walls that both divide and provide refuge. We seek to encourage critical thinking about walls, borders and global divisions.

Even one the most mobile of us seek refuge once in a while. What is the relationship between displacement and refuge? Escape and shelter? What is the meaning of Berlin’s Wall?

What Do We Need?

To fly international participants to Berlin. 7 artists, anthropologists, visual artists and a sociologist need to purchase airline tickets = $3900. 

To sleep. We go with the most economical option we can find: AirBnB. To house 7 participants we need to rent an apartment in Berlin for 7 days at 180 Euros per night = $1080.

To eat. We need to feed 12 people for 7 days at 30 Euros per day = $2520.

To cover our costs. Some of us have day jobs. Others are independent artists/ writers. Materials and rehearsal time, studio rentals need to be paid. We established five grants of 500 Euros each to support our independent members. We now need to back these grants = $2500

In total, we are looking to raise $10,000.

Impact

For this project, we are working with the congregation of the Chapel of Reconciliation at the Berlin Wall Memorial and the Refugee Office of the Protestant Dinary, Berlin North East. One goal is to collaborate with professional artists who have recently settled in Germany as a result of the wars in the Middle East. We welcome their input in our experimental setting for cross-disciplinary creative manifestations.

Our work is not oriented towards the art market, but towards reaching a multitude of publics. Exhibitions and performances are free and open to the public.

Risks & Challenges

Projects like ours demand a lot of coordination across borders, but MMTW has a history of solving problems on the ground at different sites: this is why we partner with local institutions in every place we work.

Since 2013 the MMTW has successfully organized exhibitions, performances, and participatory interventions in Romania, France, the USA and Holland. MMTW Artistic Director and Curator Susan Ossman has a long history of organizing highly successful academic and artistic events.

If our crowdfunding goals are not met, the members of our collective will find other resources to make the workshop a success.

story:
Short Summary

 I have been selected to participate in the Stanislav Libensky Award show in Prague this September. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity for me, and I need help to get to Prague.  

The Stanislav Libensky Award is an international competition for recent graduates who used glass in their final works.  I would love to be able to deliver my work
personally and to be there to show and represent my piece at the opening
night.  In the show’s five year history, this is the first time Canadian glass is being represented, and I feel privileged to be part of it.

Libensky is my glass hero! I cannot express what an honour it is for me to be selected to participate in this show.

The Perks  

I have put together some Perks at different donation levels, and as a show of my gratitude for any support or assistance, everything is listed at discounted rates. 

I am attempting to raise $2,000 to pay for my flight and hotel costs in Prague.   

 

                 

The Impact

Just over three years ago, after much contemplation I made the decision to quit my job in gemmology and to pursue a new path, as a student and artist.  I put together my application, and was accepted into the Craft & Design Program- Glass, at Sheridan College for Fall of 2011. I gave in my resignation and was off to school! 

I feel in love with glass instantly.  To be honest I had not had much experience or knowledge prior to my studies, but knew this was the right choice.  Learning to work with hot glass was intimidating to say the least and the student lifestyle was very different from what I’d been accustomed to.  Over the course of the three year program, I became more and more comfortable in the many areas of the glass studio, including glassblowing, coldworking, kilncasting andsandcasting. Being curious by nature, I began to experiment with the different processes, and with glass there was no shortage of experimentations I could think of; so many possibilities. 

One exploration I began in first year was including hand forged copper into my hotshop work. This led to using copper in sandcasting in my second year, hot casting in my third year, and many other phases of experimentation in between. It has been an exciting journey to realize my two favorite materials together in a body of work that I am proud of. 

I guess my graduating work began before Sheridan, while I was studying metal smithing / jewellery through the continuing education program at George Brown College.  This was when I first began working with copper. My love and fascination with copper was instilled in me at a very young age, I’m sure much is due to my heritage, being born in Chile. I was exposed to artisanal crafts and often admired the handmade copper jewellery at the local markets in Santiago.  My love for glass developed later on, realizing how well it could compliment glass, not only artistically, but also on a molecular lever, the two materials can be fairly compatible once you master the process. 

The work

 Paisaje de Cobre

“The reaction between the hand forged copper bowl and the high temperatures of the glass creates beautiful colour reactions producing, red, orange, and purple tones. The hot casting process also creates a strong bond between the glass and copper bowl, fused by heat.  Paisaje de cobre, has additional copper electroplated onto the surface, with high a high polished window to allow full view into the colour reaction.  To me Paisaje de cobre (copper landscape) resembles the open pit copper mines of Chile.”  

 
Stanislav Libensky Award Show

The competition serves as an international presentation of young glass artists. The aim of the competition is to help the development of glass art in the young scene and to compare different approaches and methods. The initiator and main organizer – the Prague Gallery of Czech Glass – hopes that this competition, followed by a long term exhibition, will help young artists enter the business world and explore the potential of glass.

Stanislav Libensky 

Stanislav Libenský is considered as the most outstanding Czech glasswork artist and pedagogist. His works created in collaboration with Jaroslava Brychtová are presented in museums and galleries all over the world. Besides his work, he was teaching at Academy of Arts, Architecture and Design in Prague and he was a director and pedagogist the School of Applied Arts for Glassmaking in Železný Brod where he lived and worked for the majority of his life.

Other Ways You Can Help

 Please share my campaign to help spread the word to others you feel may be interested or willing to share.  

 Shipping  

Shipping is not included in your donation amount. The cost will vary according to size, weight and location. Delivery or pick up is also an option, I will be in contact after I receive your request.
story_txt:
Short Summary I have been selected to participate in the Stanislav Libensky Award show in Prague this September. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity for me, and I need help to get to Prague.  The Stanislav Libensky Award is an international competition for recent graduates who used glass in their final works.  I would love to be able to deliver my workpersonally and to be there to show and represent my piece at the openingnight.  In the show’s five year history, this is the first time Canadian glass is being represented, and I feel privileged to be part of it.
Libensky is my glass hero! I cannot express what an honour it is for me to be selected to participate in this show. The Perks  
I have put together some Perks at different donation levels, and as a show of my gratitude for any support or assistance, everything is listed at discounted rates.

story:
(Please scroll down for English Version)

Estamos trabajando en la 2da Edición del ...


La 1ª Edición del Ibiza Enlight Festival (Octubre  de 2013) se llevó a cabo de manera maravillosamente exitosa.  El evento dio la bienvenida a 120 participantes, provenientes de 10 países, y cumplió con su cometido de celebrar las enseñanzas de UN CURSO DE MILAGROS y logró ser un evento de magnitud transformadora. De ésta manera, las Jornadas de Felicidad (en formato talleres, charlas y otras actividades), así como el ambiente del festival en sí, se vivieron con un sentido de innovación, celebración, comunidad y humildad.

Estamos agradecidos por el apoyo financiero recibido a través de Indiegogo, por nuestro 1er Festival, y por haber podido conseguir nuestra meta principal de proporcionar los billetes a nuestros 16  maestros invitados de 10 países diferentes, e inaugurar el festival al cubrir otros gastos iniciales.

http://www.ibizaenlightfestival.com/

 

LA SANACIÓN ES UNA EMPRESA DE COLABORACIÓN

Somos tres, que nos hemos unido para responder a la llamada del Amor.    


IBIZA ENLIGHT es una Asociación de reciente creación sin ánimo de lucro, concebida por Carolina Corada, Steve Thompson y Salvador Rodríguez para compartir y celebrar las enseñanzas de UN CURSO DE MILAGROS.

NUESTRA META

Estamos comprometidos con ofrecer la 2da Edición del Ibiza Enlight Festival, del 4 al 12 Octubre, 2014, para lo cual, aún habiendo logrado cubrir todos los gastos de la 1ª Edición, seguimos gestionando fondos de distintas maneras para conseguir apoyo financiero, incluyendo Indiegogo como una de las más efectivas.

Es por ello que este año nuevamente Agradecemos Tu Donativo para:

  • Comprar los billetes de los 10 maestros invitados. ( 1 de Estados Unidos,    1 de Brasil, 1 de México, 3 de Dinamarca, 1 de Alemania y  3 de España)
  • Comprar el billete de nuestra Coordinadora de Traducción desde Argentina y Maestra, Patricia Besada
  • Desarrollar la nueva web del evento
  • Editar nuevos vídeos promocionales y fotografías
  • Invertir en otros gastos derivados de la organización previa del encuentro.


NUESTRO IMPACTO

  • Hemos concebido y estrenado un Festival -único en su género- para Celebrar Un Curso de Milagros  y con mucha alegría ! 
  • Hemos conseguido experimentar por unos días una convivencia comunitaria en la que todos nos apoyamos desinteresadamente, en un ambiente de profunda conexión interior, y dónde el agradecimiento de todos hacia todos se podía respirar. 
  • Los participantes pudieron integrarse en la comunidad de la isla de Ibiza con un día de voluntariado en " Deixalles"   & " Ibiza 4 Patas ". 
  • Lo más importante: estudiantes & maestros de UCDM pusimos una dosis de buena voluntad para trascender nuestras aparentes diferencias y encontrarnos sin juicios más allá de las culturas y de los idiomas.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que recibirás

  • Necesitamos aproximadamente 6.500 euros para los 11 billetes; para la web unos +1.500; la edición de fotos y vídeos cuyos precios aún no sabemos y el resto +2.000 para el diseño e impresión de banderolas, material promocional y preparativos iniciales.  
  • Te ofrecemos nuevamente nuestros Regalos de Gratitud y este año particularmente estamos trabajando en nuestro 'Cuaderno de Gratitud': Un lindo cuaderno para anotaciones, que refleja la dicha y nuestra historia de Amor con hermosas fotos. 
  • Tu Aportación es muy importante para nosotros.  Cualquiera que sea el monto que logremos recaudar, será invertido con mucho Amor y para el beneficio de la Filiación.   ¡ Muchas Gracias ! 

Con nuestra petición y tu colaboración también te invitamos a:

DEJAR IR las diferencias con respecto a la ‘forma’ en que los diversos maestros enseñan y LIBERAR la idea acerca de que ‘algunas culturas o idiomas son mejores que otras’. Ayúdanos por favor a COMPARTIR esta campaña con las diversas comunidades de UCDM.

Scott/USA, Rod/UK, Carolina/Spain, Marialcira/Venezuela, Paul/USA, Alice/Canada,   Sallyan/UK,     Dennis/Canada

Es nuestro COMPROMISO continuar realizando este evento internacional en apoyo a cada Maestro de Dios -famoso o desconocido, mediático o no- ya que en el Ibiza Enlight Festival, hay sitio para todos ! 

Para más información sobre cómo ayudar, pincha en cualquiera de los siguientes enlaces

Facebook   Canal Youtube   Twitter   Web  

Escríbenos:   Email:  indiegogo@ibizaenlightfestival.com


******ENGLISH VERSION ******


We are working in the 2nd Edition of ...



The 1st  Edition of the Ibiza Enlight Festival (October  2013) was a wonderful successful.  The event welcomed 120 participants, from 10 countries and achieved its ultimate goal of celebrating the teachings of  A COURSE IN MIRACLES, in a Week of Happiness and powerful transformational experiences through workshops, talks and other activities, in an atmosphere of innovation, celebration, community and humbleness.  

We are grateful for the financial support we received through Indiegogo, for our 1st-ever Festival, and for being able to reach all our main objectives: purchasing international tickets for our 16 teachers invited from 10 different countries and covering the initial costs necessary to making the festival happen.

http://www.ibizaenlightfestival.com/


Healing is a Joint Venture

We are but three, who have joined as One to respond to the calling of Love. 


IBIZA ENLIGHT is a  not-for-profit  association of recent creation by Carolina Corada, Steve Thompson and Salvador Rodriguez, whose ultimate goal is to share A Course in Miracles.

OUR GOAL

We are committed to offering the 2nd Edition of the Ibiza Enlight Festival, from October 4th to 12th, 2014.  Even though we were able to cover all the costs of the 1st Edition, we are still aiming at Crowd Funding and other donation initiatives to receive the financial support we need, Indiegogo being one of the most effective ones.

This is why this year once again we are Grateful for Your Donation to:

  • Purchase 10 airplane tickets for the 10 invited teachers. ( 1 from USA, 1  from Brazil, 1 from Mexico, 3 from Denmark, 1 from Germany &  3 from Spain)
  • Buy the airplane ticket for our Translation Coordinator & Teacher, from Argentina, Patricia Besada
  • Develop the new Festival’s web
  • Editing new promotional videos and photos
  • Investing in other expenses derived from the pre-production of the event.


OUR IMPACT

  • We have conceived and shared a Festival –unique in its genre- to Celebrate A Course in Miracle & with a lot of Joy! 
  • We were able to experience for a few days a community-style living were everyone supported each other without hidden agendas, in a profound inner connection where we could ‘breathe’ the gratitude everyone had for each other. 
  • The participants were able to ‘shine their light’ and integrate with the island of Ibiza’s community through the Volunteering Day at " Deixalles "   & " Ibiza 4 Patas ".
  • Most important: ACIM students & teachers joined in their willingness to transcend the apparent differences and go beyond judgement, cultures and languages.

What we need & what you will receive

  • We need about 6.500 euros to pay for the 11 flights; for the web, about +1.500; for the editing & videos we don´t yet know, and for the rest, about +2.000 for the design & printing of the promotional material and other initial expenses.  
  • We offer you our Gratitude Gifts and this year we have been working on our new ‘Gratitude Notebook': A notebook for your inspirations, where our story is told in beautiful photos reflecting the joy & the love of the Festival. 
  • Your Donation is Very Important for us.  Whatever the amount collected, it will be invested with a lot of Love and on behalf of the Sonship.  Thank you very much!  

With our petition and your collaboration we also invite you to:

LET GO of the differences with respect to ‘the form’ used by the diverse teachers to teach & RELEASE the idea that says that ‘there are some cultures or languages that are better than others.’  Help us please to SHARE this campaign and this Festival within the many ACIM communities.

Scott/USA, Rod/UK, Carolina/Spain, Marialcira/Venezuela, Paul/USA, Alice/Canada,   Sallyan/UK,     Dennis/Canada

It is our COMMITMENT to continue organizing this international event to support each Teacher of God –famous or unknown, in the media or not- because there is room for All in the  Ibiza Enlight Festival.

For more information on how to help, please click in any of the links below.

Our YouTube Channel   Facebook   Twitter    Our Web

Write to us at:   Email:  indiegogo@ibizaenlightfestival.com

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to the Vassar College Senior Art Majors' Indiegogo Campaign. As we approach the end of our time as peers here in Poughkeepsie, we are all looking forward to making a lasting impression on campus with our own artwork and annual art show. This show has moved locations over the years, and we have decided to host it in our very own New Hackensack studio this May. We are very excited to finally have this chance to showcase our four years' worth of work, and we would appreciate any support you can offer towards that end.

What We Need & What You Get

Because the show will take place on-campus and in a non-gallery space, we need your help to renovate and decorate the area come show-time. The funds we receive- whether we are fully-funded or not- would go toward cleaning and renovating the space, including the construction of new walls for display; they would help us provide each artist with the space and materials they need; and they would ensure that we can provide refreshments for all of our supporters on opening day. With your funding and the hard work of the senior majors, we will have an art show that is professional and spectacular.

The Impact

The senior art show is a tradition that every Vassar College art major looks forward to upon their graduation. It is an opportunity for us to make an artistic impact on the school and our peers, on the underclassmen, and on all who attend from home or the surrounding area. It is a celebration of all that we have accomplished as a group and allows us to leave campus with a sense of purpose toward our own artistic futures. We would appreciate any and all support not only from members of the Vassar community, but also from all who wish to see our artistic careers grow.

Risks & Challenges

Our talented professors and department staff have been overseeing this process for many years now. The show has been held in this venue before, and the space is familiar to all of us. Though the work of cleaning and preparing the space will be grueling, we are confident - as a group and with the help of our staff and supporters- that we can put our resources to good use and celebrate our accomplishments in style.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not decide to donate, please know that you can contribute to our efforts in many other ways. By spreading the word about our event and our efforts, you can help support the artists themselves as they move toward the future. 

Thank you for visiting, and we look forward to hopefully seeing many of you on opening day!

We would appreciate any and all support not only from members of the Vassar community, but also from all who wish to see our artistic careers grow.
    Risks & Challenges Our talented professors and department staff have been overseeing this process for many years now. The show has been held in this venue before, and the space is familiar to all of us. Though the work of cleaning and preparing the space will be grueling, we are confident - as a group and with the help of our staff and supporters- that we can put our resources to good use and celebrate our accomplishments in style.
    Other Ways You Can Help If you do not decide to donate, please know that you can contribute to our efforts in many other ways. By spreading the word about our event and our efforts, you can help support the artists themselves as they move toward the future. 
Thank you for visiting, and we look forward to hopefully seeing many of you on opening day!

story:
Note: Please click on the reward tiers to show the descriptions and contents of each! They don't show perk fields automatically.

You're walking the streets of Divinity's Reach when something familiar catches your eye on the stand. It's a magazine you recognize, one you've picked up before, and it screams out to you like gold to a skritt. You can't help but wonder and you pick it up – What could be in it this time? 

The Tyrian Gazette project is the annual collaboration of the GW2 Artist Collective, a branch of the Alchemy Art Group. The book’s contributors are making an “in-game” magazine, where all ads, articles and designs are made in a way to recreate how a magazine might look in the world of Tyria if you were walking the streets today. 

Coming from the talents of 82 contributors, the book asks the readers questions about the world: What is important to them? What would a magazine think is relevant from the standpoint of Divinity’s Reach, bringing in Elonian influences? What would they be looking out for normally? The magazine assumes the role of a periodical that has come out frequently, and is trusted by the city to educate, entertain and inform them of these things.

The book's tone is fun and in the spirit of the times, but also serious as it takes a look at current events and how they've impacted the world. (Note: We have put all things from the last living world episode under "Current Events," which is our spoiler section. You can look at the rest of the book spoiler free if you're not caught up.)

The goal of the book is to capture the feeling of being a citizen of Tyria by painting our adventures in a moment-to-moment snapshot. We've designed the book to be cohesive and lore-consistent, and any reader should be able to flip through the pages and get a sense of the world that’s been brought to life by the team of Guild Wars 2, and through the contributors who have loved the game for many years. 

The book has an original cover (Eternity) and one variant specialty cover (Juggernaut). Eternity is the default version. The slip case will be able to be purchased in the post-campaign (unless you purchase it now with the Skritt Box add-on - see details in the Merchandise section).

The book is sized at 8.5"x11" (standard magazine). There is a stretch goal to upgrade it from paperback to hardcover (applies to both the original cover design and variant).

 

In the Tyrian Gazette, we showcase a number of features from a few major sections, including Wintersday, current events, fashion and more. While fashion isn't the whole book, we've dedicated a section to it to show off some creative flair with the "Fashion Wars" that the community affectionately partakes in, bringing in our own spin on designs in the game (all looked at by our seamstress for their designs).

There are two options for getting the merchandise in the campaign: You can get everything through the Skritt Box right now OR you can wait until the post-campaign to add items on if you want certain things individually.

  • Pins (Stained Glass Cities) - Only come in the package design when all bought together
  • Prints of various pieces in the campaign, 8"x10" - Select 3 available prints (selected in surveys) 
  • GW2 Coin Set - Coins designed after GW2 in-game currencies, available as a set (1/4 unlocked with the backing card)
  • Sticker Sheet (Mail Carriers) - Free stretch goal with the books (unlocked)
  • Individual Vinyl Sticker - TBD - Stretch goals
  • Holographic Postcard - Free stretch goal with the books (locked)
  • Slipcase for Book - Available in the Skritt Hoard or an survey add-on (comes already wrapped around the book) (unlocked!)

As noted above, you can add items via the "add-on tiers" found when you select the book, or you can wait for the BackerKit program. We've worked with them for several projects, and promise it's a seamless process. 

For the add-on for both the GW2 limited items (shown under rewards), the wallpapers for desktop and phone, and the skritt box (which features all physical items in the campaign), you can find them by pressing on a book tier and pressing "add perk" when it appears below.

In this campaign, there are a few specific additions that are listed under "Add-Ons" that appear as you're selecting a perk. ArenaNet has donated a few specialty items, listed below, that are only available through the campaign. The proceeds of all of these are donated to charity. 

The specialty items are:

  • The Art of Guild Wars 2 (Sold Out)
  • Signed Tyrian Gazette books from the ArenaNet dev team (Sold Out)
  • GW2 Toasters (they burn the logo on toast!) (Sold Out)
  • GW2 Collector's Edition (includes 10-inch Figurine of Rytlock, 112-page Making of Guild Wars 2 book, Best of Guild Wars 2 Soundtrack CD, Art Portfolio and Five Art Prints, and Custom Art Frame, along with other digital items) (Sold Out)
  • GW1 Nightfall Computer Case (Sold Out)

ALL ITEMS HERE ARE SOLD OUT. (Here is the previous image we had posted - removed on 8/7 since everything was claimed.) We'll notify everyone if this changes!

The only other items that are available in the campaign are commissions (see below), merchandise (noted in the previous section - addable in the post-campaign survey sent out to all pledgers OR with the skritt box add-on), and the variant cover edition (Juggernaut).

As with previous campaigns, we're offering commissions from some of the participating artists, listed below. Many of our artists do this for a living, and if you like commissioning works, it's a good way to support them! 

There's a limited number for each tier, and we won't be adding any more. Once you've pledged, we'll send you information via email to connect you with the artist. Examples are listed next to their names; you will have through the end of the campaign to correspond with them and chat about sketches. All tiers include a print of the commission on museum-quality paper (giclee) and a Tyrian Gazette book.

ALL COMMISSIONS ARE SOLD AT THIS TIME. Thank you!! <3

Sold Out Commissions: Shahina (Tier 1 - 2 Slots), Kyla Frank (Tier 1 - 2 Slots), Grace Zhu (Tier 1 - 2 Slots), Jen Forth (Tier 1 - 2 Slots), Katalean (Tier 2 - 2 slots), KoboldArt (Tier 3 - 2 slots), Casondra Logan (Tier 3 - 2 slots), Joshua Cadogan (Tier 5 - 1 slot)

With the campaign, we have some stretch goals and pledge goals for meeting milestones! For the stretch goals, they're based on monetary adjustments for added items; for pledge goals, it's based off of the number of people who have joined the campaign.

We will update the following as things are unlocked, so stay tuned to these (and our updates) to watch for more! (Please also refer to the FAQ on more about goals!) :D

The creators that participate in the project are both newcomers to the Collective's works, and others are reoccurring artists that you may have seen in other projects like Tyrian Tarot and the Wintersday Zines. We always strive to foster projects that pursue a high standard, both in content and what the product ultimately is. We hope you'll take a moment to meet our contributors for the Tyrian Gazette below!

Artists:
Aclyr  |  Aketan |  Ale | Alexandre Coadou | Angelique van der Mee  |  AnonEi  |  Brighan Cernunnos  |  Casondra Logan  |  Chilkat  |  Ciorane  |  Cruz Fox  |  Dagos  |  DeusExMoose  |  DiesVitae  |  Dylan Choonhachat  |  Ennun Ana Iurov  |  evermeer  |  Favrocious  |  Flutti  |  Gears2Gnomes  |  Grace Zhu  |  Grise  |  Henry Ng  |  Htg17  |  Isvoc  |  Jaqueline Florencio  |  Jen Forth  |  Josephine Frayling  |  Joshua Cadogan  |  Juuni  |  katalean  |  Ki-Re  |  kingbaest  |  Kire Torres  |  KoboldArt  |  Kromi  |  Kyla Frank  |  Landylachs  |  Lunarmare  |  Mabaki  |  Marmarris  |  Mayosha Dyck  |  Michele Montini  |  Numerous Sybils  |  Owlma  |  Paul Emery  |  Penslinger  |  PlaviGmaz  |  Rex  |  Rookfern  |  Route13  |  Rusavia  |  Sffau  |  Shahina  |  Shayna Fairbanks  |  Shunkaku  |  sockpoppet  |  Tealful Eyes  |  Tetraethyl  |  Xayah  |  Yanli Wang  |  Yazzart  |  zettanoia  

Writers:
Amala  |  Claire Flannagan  |  Ghost  |  Jon/Lys  |  Josh Wall  |  Keru Faye  |  Kora  |  LadyXesphio  |  M.S. Sparrow  |  Rex Fang  |  Summer Lawson  | TottWriter  |  Zachary Rosenblum

Additional Help From:
Benjamin Lee (Incendium)  |  Enayla Cosplay

Organizers:
Mel Sayre (Zorav)  |  Sara Squires (Qesque)  |  Jéssica M. (Thunderpot)

With each of our projects, we attempt to make something unique and engaging, bringing together contributors to make a cohesive final product. We look for a challenge but something that ultimately reflects the workmanship of all of the talents from around the world. 

We're also incredibly thankful to have so much support for our passionate group, and are very glad that these projects help good causes in the process. All of the contributors put a ton of hard work into their pieces, and it means so much knowing the impact it holds.

All of these projects are run by individuals in the community, and Mel (and the other organizers) work alongside ArenaNet to get their blessing to make it happen. 

The timeline above is our projected path to finishing the project. We'll communicate any delays in the process in updates here and on social media.

For the book, we ship worldwide using two different carriers: USPS priority shipping for domestic orders (tracked and insured) and DHL for international shipments (tracked to door). The book package is roughly estimated to be about 3.5 lbs total. We've normalized prices to be $10 for shipping in the U.S. and $15 for international shipments. International shipments generally do cost more than that; we'll cover anything above that cost.

For smaller items (notably the pin collection by itself), shipping is by first class mail for the U.S. (tracked) and DHL for international shipments (also tracked). It's weight related for both, and shipments are $5 and $8 respectively for those packages. 

Please note that the tiers are first-come, first-serve for the books and they ship out in one-month increments as noted in the tiers' descriptions. You can't move between the tiers once they've been fully claimed. (If we manage to ship out more than the listed number in a month, we'll move onto the next tier as scheduled. We do these custom shipments by hand so please bear with us!)

All duties/import fees are the responsibility of the recipient for international orders, if they apply. Items are declared as required by customs law.

For the image above, we've estimated it for a 1,000 count book run. We've estimated these figures to the best of our ability, but prices do fluctuate over time (and percentages with it), along with variables such as varying merchandise counts and costs. We hope that these values hold as true as possible to our projections.

As with any project of this size, there are always the potential problems that arise. We've done several projects now of various sizes, and always learn and adjust as much as we can from each.

For this project, we have worked to fix some of the logistical issues that happened for shipping in Tyrian Tarot by controlling the tiers and their shipping dates, along with having hard cutoffs for the months. While this creates a limit on what we'll produce, it'll hopefully establish more reasonably expectations for when the books will be in everyone's hands.

This is our fourth large charity Guild Wars 2 project, led by the same humans, and one of many big projects that we've done, including independent projects and others for fandoms. We'll be working again to be fulfilling projects as effectively as we can, and promise to communicate any issues or delays if they do occur. 

We're aiming to have all of the art and writing completed by the time the campaign ends, and will spend the time following the campaign (and the survey) polishing and perfecting the design and layouts. Our goal is to make a memorable campaign that gives to a cause that we (and our sponsoring company) believe in.

We hope you're consider supporting the project, and loving the art and world we've trying to honor as much as we do. If you have any questions, please feel free to answer them at gw2collective@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

The Sound of My Heart is a new collective initiated by a small group of women from diverse backgrounds based in Ottawa on Algonquin Territory, whose goal is to carry on the Honouring Indigenous Women (HIW) campaign. HIW's sole mandate is to publish the productions of Indigenous women and their allies through the arts of storytelling, poetry, painting, drawing, photography, and sound.

Inspired by the publication - Honouring Indigenous Women, Hearts of Nations - Vol. 1, this campaign will continue to further raise awareness about protecting and honouring Indigenous women and strives to put an end to all forms of violence. It offers a space to deepen our understanding of Indigenous women on Turtle Island (North America) and to foster strong solidarity between native and non-native communities. It is an act of solidarity toward supporting the existing efforts of Indigenous women.

Following the call for the making of Honouring Indigenous Women, Hearts of Nations - Vol. 2 (Summer 2012), Indigenous women alongside allies from many nations contributed creative writing, visual art, and photography that reflect lived experiences with regards to their relationship with the land, birth mothers, families, communities, and themselves.

We are very grateful for the authors and artists who courageously shared their stories with us. As a result, this second anthology was born and published online in November 2012.

We are seeking funds to print 800 copies of this book in preparation for a multi-city launch of this anthology for an Autumn 2013 release which includes Vancouver, Edmonton, Regina, Toronto, Peterborough, Ottawa and Manistee. These launches will reach more people to whom we also would like to share the wealth of knowledge and inspiration this book offers to empower all peoples to tell and share their stories.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking you to help us raise $6,000 to cover the printing cost of 800 copies of Honouring Indigenous Women, Hearts of Nations - Vol. 2. In addition, we estimate another $1000 for shipping and other expenses associated with the multi-city launch such as honoraria.

We are excited to offer several perks for you including: a copy of the Honouring Indigenous Women, Hearts of Nations - Vol. 1 & Vol. 2; a set of 8 postcards of unique visuals from Vol. 2; and a print of the cover artwork by Yolanda Teresa Philgreen.

We also would like to offer organizations who wish to doate $500 or more toward this campaign to have your organizations' logo appear on the back cover of this book as our proud sponsors. If you are interested in this offer, please contact us! Our e-mail address is thesoundofmyheartcollective(at)gmail.com.

      

The Impact

When the Honouring Indigenous Women campaign was launched in 2011, many Indigenous women praised this initiative as it was creating a place for Indigenous women’s voices while offering a complimentary space to allies and alliances. Indigenous women recognized the importance of this space as their voices were not marginalized or on the peripheral. As we have learned, the mainstream media often reinforces stereotypes and patriarchal thinking towards Indigenous women in their stories, and often does not portray the whole picture.

This anthology is a re-presentation of Indigenous women by Indigenous women by  sharing lived experiences, realities and offering unique perspectives of each contributors’ worldview.

It is a celebration and a practice of freedom for both its creators and readers.

Last but not least, the creation of this book has empowered each of us who got involved. We would like to extend our gratitude for this powerful experience to all of you out there who also love and care for equality and justice.    

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word on Facebook and Twitter! Let your friends know about our campaign!

If you just want to get in touch, please feel free to write to us @ thesoundofmyheartcollective(at)gmail.com

These launches will reach more people to whom we also would like to share the wealth of knowledge and inspiration this book offers to empower all peoples to tell and share their stories.


What We Need & What You Get
We are asking you to help us raise $6,000 to cover the printing cost of 800 copies of Honouring Indigenous Women, Hearts of Nations - Vol. 2. In addition, we estimate another $1000 for shipping and other expenses associated with the multi-city launch such as honoraria.
We are excited to offer several perks for you including: a copy of the Honouring Indigenous Women, Hearts of Nations - Vol. 1 & Vol. 2; a set of 8 postcards of unique visuals from Vol. 2; and a print of the cover artwork by Yolanda Teresa Philgreen.
We also would like to offer organizations who wish to doate $500 or more toward this campaign to have your organizations' logo appear on the back cover of this book as our proud sponsors. If you are interested in this offer, please contact us! Our e-mail address is thesoundofmyheartcollective(at)gmail.com.
      


The Impact
When the Honouring Indigenous Women campaign was launched in 2011, many Indigenous women praised this initiative as it was creating a place for Indigenous women’s voices while offering a complimentary space to allies and alliances. Indigenous women recognized the importance of this space as their voices were not marginalized or on the peripheral. As we have learned, the mainstream media often reinforces stereotypes and patriarchal thinking towards Indigenous women in their stories, and often does not portray the whole picture.
This anthology is a re-presentation of Indigenous women by Indigenous women by  sharing lived experiences, realities and offering unique perspectives of each contributors’ worldview.
It is a celebration and a practice of freedom for both its creators and readers.
Last but not least, the creation of this book has empowered each of us who got involved. We would like to extend our gratitude for this powerful experience to all of you out there who also love and care for equality and justice.    


Other Ways You Can Help
Help us spread the word on Facebook and Twitter! Let your friends know about our campaign!
If you just want to get in touch, please feel free to write to us @ thesoundofmyheartcollective(at)gmail.com

story:
ETERNAL, a fusion of cinema, theater and installation, is my most conceptually ambitious work to date. In July, I assembled a film crew to shoot Thomas Jay Ryan and Christina Rouner performing the final scene of the 2003 film ETERNAL SUNSHINE OF THE SPOTLESS MIND in a continuous loop for two hours — the only constraint: they must keep going, no matter what happens. The unedited two-channel video of their performance will be projected on two adjacent screens. ETERNAL premieres at Incubator Arts Project  in NYC: October 8-20. Funds raised through this campaign will go towards paying the actors, designers, and technicians who shot the work and are creating the unusual scenic, video, light and audio environment in which the show will be experienced.

What, if some day or night a demon were to steal after you and say: "This life as you now live it and have lived it, you will have to live once more and innumerable times more; ...every pain and every joy and every thought and sigh and will have to return to you, all in the same succession and sequence - The eternal hourglass of existence is turned upside down again and again, and you with it, speck of dust!How well disposed would you have to become to yourself and to life to crave nothing more fervently than this ultimate eternal confirmation and seal?- Nietzsche 

My goals are to make big-minded, challenging work and to pay my collaborators a real wage--more than they would make at most  NYC Off-Bway Theaters.To that end every dollar raised through this campaign will go toward artist fees.

For twenty years, I have been making innovative, weird work for theater, opera and film throughout the US and abroad.  I've reinterpreted dramatic classics (HAMLET, TARTUFFE, OKLAHOMA!) through disorienting stagings, and found theater where none was intended, as in the writing of David Foster Wallace ( A radically condensed and expanded SUPPOSEDLY FUN THING I’LL NEVER DO AGAIN) and Jonathan Franzen (HOUSE FOR SALE). My work strives to be at once conceptually rigorous and theatrically lavish

Collaborators on ETERNAL are: Thomas Jay Ryan, Christina Rouner, Blanca Añon, Thomas Dunn, Terese Wadden, Andrew Lazarow, Michael Koshkin, Mark Van Hare, Daniel Kluger,  Patrick Southern , Osheen Jones, Ryan Hatch.

story:
Paths to Pier 42

Paths to Pier 42 will be a series of art, educational, and design installations and public events along the East River Waterfront in the summer of 2013 by the Lower East Side Waterfront Alliance with Lower Manhattan Cultural Council.

The project will create a pop-up waterfront park that will increase access to and public enjoyment of Pier 42 while it awaits permanent transformation into a new public park over the next several years. Paths to Pier 42 installations will model activities that can and will take place on the waterfront once it is fully redeveloped.

 

 

 

Where your money goes

The money we raise will be used to implement overall site improvements needed to take this from an abandoned pier site into a welcoming pop-up park for the Lower East Side!

These improvements will be based on recommendations from Leroy Street Studio (architecture firm) and dlandstudio (landscape architecture firm). They have met with the Lower East Side Waterfront Alliance members and the Paths to Pier 42 Advisory Committee to create a comprehensive site strategy plan that will create a space that is welcoming and accommodating to the needs of the neighborhood. They have also consulted with the five selected artists developing projects for the Pier to ensure that each of the artist installations is sited in a cohesive manner. 

You'll get the satisfaction of knowing you are helping to create great public spaces and community-driven art. You'll also get great stuff from Paths to Pier 42 shirts and buttons all the way up to a framed professionally printed print of the rendering of the pop-up park created by Leroy Street Studio and dlandstudio. Perks will be sent to supporters within 45 days of the campaign end date. 

The Impact

The project addresses the need for sustainable planning in a densely populated urban area that has been subject to development pressures over the last decade and more recently suffered damage from Hurricane Sandy. Paths to Pier 42 will be the first step in making a large, neglected parcel along the waterfront into a multi-use and accessible piece of open space for the community. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Join us this summer for a series of community events and our kickoff in July. Check out http://pathstopier42.com/ for more details.

You can also help by spreading the word! Tell your friends and family, and let them know you support great public spaces and community-driven design.
