story:
Summary

 Hello everyone! My name is Hera and I'm a 17 year old photographer, painter, and poet! 

I've been offered an internship with the art collective, HOWDOYOUSAYYAMINAFRICAN. A collective of "artists, writers, composers, academics, filmmakers and performers from around the world who collaborate across disciplines and cities.” These artists will be installing an exhibit in "Witte De With", a museum of contemporary art in Rotterdam, Netherlands. I've been offered the opportunity to help in this installation! My only obstacle, is getting there! 

My Work With the Yams

I've been able to help the collective by helping to install a sculpture in the Jacob Lawrence Gallery in Seattle, Washington entitled “The Immortal Uterus”. It was inspired by Henrietta Lacks, a black woman who had cervical cancer in the 50s. Her cells were extracted from her cervix without her permission and have become the the basis for cell research and medicine, to this day.


This was a project in which we gathered thousands of old VHS tapes, taking them apart one by one, and weaving the film into a massive sculpture! It was a long and tedious job and I even found myself spending the nights in the art gallery and missing a couple hours of school!  However, I've learned so much and have gained so much experience from this project. This instillation has taught me the values of hard work and patience, and art is not to be rushed. I hope to apply these values to my own art. 



What I Need & What You Get

  • I am seeking $1500 for a round trip plane ticket to the Netherlands, and $1000 to go towards my food and accommodation needs! (*a portion of the funds will go to Indiegogo)
  • No matter what amount you donate, you will receive a special thank you, personally written by me! Gifts will also range from post-cards to paintings made by me, specially for you!

My Art

 I love to express myself through all types of art whether it's photography or painting! I'm interested in portraiture and one of my favorite artists, Frida Kahlo says, "I paint myself because I am the one I know best." 


 I've interned at the Gary International Black Film Festival and premiered my very own film there! I also curated my first show in Portland, Oregon at Caldera Arts. While I do love taking self portraits, I also like to capture movement as well. Whether through dance or in nature, I find myself attracted to the way things move. 


The Impact
As a young black female artist, this is a great opportunity for me to explore and gain experience in the art world. Going to the Netherlands will allow me to see a different part of the world that I've never seen before, and give me the opportunity to explore art in a way that I've never been able to. I'm inspired by the art created around the world and I hope to inspire people with my art around the world. 

Risks & Challenges

I'm running this campaign for only two weeks, because the trip is next month. I was notified about this internship on short notice, but I'm confident I can raise the money with your help!

Thank You

I want to thank everyone for taking the time to read this! Your donation (of whatever amount) is greatly appreciated! Thank you so much for supporting and believing in me!

story:
NEWS:

THANK YOU ALL FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!! I'm now making the new cards, with the money raised I'm working on 10 new cards to ship out, UPDATES WILL BE AT www.popupsfortoronto.com <- Check it out also if you want to buy custom popup cards from me! THANKS AGAIN, KEEP CHECKING THE SITE! Cutting the cards up right now :)


Short Story

Hey there, I'm Lucky! For the last 5 years I've been working my but off to get to the city I love to pursue a dream in animation and i can really use your help with funding this project! I'm going to send 100 popup cards custom made to 100 animation  companies in Toronto hoping that one of them will like me enough for me to land a job in the city I love! Not happy with the Short Story? Scroll down for the Real Story!




What I Need & What You Get

This is where I need your help, I cant possibility afford all the printing and sending costs all of these cards having spent all of my money on the first batch last time.. The 30 cards cost me $600US to print in good quality and send , so it would cost close to $2000 to print . But it will also cost more to send them with  BETTER quality and BETTER shipping that won't get lost cards. And i most definitely cant afford the plane ticket to Canada and visa costs again! So this is what I'm fundraising for, the cards and plane ticket costs. I humbly request your help with this, you have no idea how much this would mean to me! 


List of original 30 places I sent the cards to,


 I'll send out the new ones to most of these guys again as well as a LOT of other places in Toronto and the rest of Canada!


If I don't get the full amount I'll send 50 companies, if i dont get enough for 50 i'll send 10, but whatever I get I'll use it towards my goal like I do with every dollar I've earned for the past 5 years!!!


For your help I'll send you out custom prints and first issue of my comic books! And I can even make you some custom popup cards too!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant afford to donate and you live in Toronto just telling someone about me would also be equally as fantastic! As long as someone can help me out with getting the work visa to come back to the city i love and want to work in I would be forever grateful!  And gently build myself back up so I can work in animation and inspire people like I aimed for all along that would mean EVERYTHING to me




Long Story

Since childhood I've been aiming to work in the cartoon industry and I've always aimed for the top! 5 years ago I decided once and for all that I don't care that I don't live in the US or Canada I can still get there and work on the amazing shows I've watched as a child and inspire children the same way they inspired me!


So I started a website 4 years ago , the animators dream where I asked for people's help in helping me achieve the goal of studying the city I've always wanted to live and work at and maybe If I got enough donators I could perhaps reach my goal! You can still find a web archive version of the site at http://web.archive.org/web/20080224013305/http://animatorsdream.com/




 But that's not all, I went out into the streets and did caricatures every day in hopes that i would be able to save enough to get to my goal! 


I managed to save up 4-5 thousand over the course of 2 years and my parents god bless them chipped in with all of their savings to give me another 6-7 in order to at least have enough money to afford 1 year! I decided that's enough for me to get started, I spent 1 year  studying my but off there and trying my hardest in Toronto so I can stay and work there! It was amazing! The most amazing city I've lived in, i tried so hard to stay there! But my visa didn't allow me to work there legally so i was stuck, i couldn't apply anywhere! 


I had some small work coming in and out, but by the time the school year was over i was completely flat broke! I only had enough money for my plane ticket home… until a job came in. 


On which the person said if i finish they'll get me a work visa, guaranteed. It was an animation job and I was super excited! But on the same day my computer broke down…. I couldn't finish the job, I couldn't even start it with no computer! 


So I thought well… I've got a thousand left… for my plane ticket… or… I can take a leap of faith! So I spent the money on a new computer instead so I can finish the job and stay!

 

I spent 3 months on the job, barely paying the rent, eating rice and cereal, but all in hope to get the work visa. Well the person lied…they just needed cheap labour and disappeared after i finished the job… Fortunately during that time i saved up enough money little by little to get the plane ticket. And nothing else! I didn't have any choice now, i left the country in the most horrible state. I didn't even have cash for the bus fares to the airport or food on the plane !  

The next year was the most depressing year of my life, i felt like i failed at everything and could never achieve the goal i set out to achieve and was forever stuck here. But then something happened, thanks to amazing artists like Bobby Chiu and Stephen Silver who gave online talks on having a goal and sticking to it no matter what I built my confidence back up until the point where I thought Yeah I can do it! 

So what if I'm really far away, why should that stop me?

So I said right I'm going to apply for work now! It doesn't matter if that I'm not in Toronto hopefully SOME place will like me enough to hire me. But I want to be different , if i just email them that wouldn't be special enough… so what would be…..

So I made 30 custom popup cards while with school and work on the side. All  containing my cv and showreel displayed as the surface of the moon inhabited by a small boy and his spaceship like the one above! 


Spent everything I have on it, and more! Posted it to 30 companies with the cheapest stamps  I  could afford. I got 4 replies, 1 said they don't do the actual animation and they don't hire people but loved my reel, 2 said they love my reel but they don't have work and 1 offered me and internship! But turned  me down when they found out I didn't have a canadian residency…. But those other 25? No response for months! I assume they all got lost in the mail, they were just average letter types so all the work might have just gone lost somewhere. Again I thought what i could i do now… i'm completely out if ideas...



So I thought I can make a comic book! I can send it out to the Toronto companies, certainly that would make a nice new way of receiving an application! So I made a comic off moon boy!

http://pencilsandcoffee.blogspot.com/2011/07/moon-boy.html


Afterwords though It cost me so much to print it i don't think i can afford to send them all out  and what if it gets lost in the mail again...

So I said to myself I can make a better popup card! Even bigger! With my comic book attached to it as well!  With better print quality, more cards, i want to send 100 popup cards to  100 companies, make them ALL custom made for each individual company and send them all out as packages instead of letters so I have more space i can use to design AND they wont get lost in the mail !

The Impact

If this doesn't happen and I can't get the visa I'll be stuck here as a barman for quite a long while, this is my last bit of hope and I've done every thing i can possibly imagine doing, if this doesn't work out i'll never be able to achieve my dream of inspiring kids and i'll be spending the next 20 years serving drunks in my small town. I really dont want to think like that but it is the worst case scenario. I can only pray that'll never happen and this WILL be successful  I WILL get to Toronto, my goal WILL become a reality



Thank you so much for giving this a shot and like my animators dream site said Every dollar really does count, and when I achieve my lifelong dream I'll have YOU to thank for it!

I really dont want to think like that but it is the worst case scenario. I can only pray that'll never happen and this WILL be successful  I WILL get to Toronto, my goal WILL become a reality




Thank you so much for giving this a shot and like my animators dream site said Every dollar really does count, and when I achieve my lifelong dream I'll have YOU to thank for it!

story:
OUR PROJECT

The Barbed Wire Whipping Party was recorded by the Grateful Dead in 1969 for their album AoxomoxoA, but vetoed from the album at the last second by poet and lyricist Robert Hunter.

 

Now, for the first time, and with Hunter’s permission, the Dead’s famous 16 track studio experiment is being performed live, while being interpreted into movement, sculpture, and lighting.

 

We are a group of theatrically trained artists and designers who have been working for nearly a year to interpret the poem and recording into a collaborative, experimental multi-disciplinary arts experience.

 

We have identified characters and a narrative through the text and the audio recording of the poem, and will build and install our interpretive sculpture and associated lighting at ArtsWalk, a public arts festival in Olympia WA, with a group of performers interpreting the poem through physical action and vocally re-creating the experience of listening to the Grateful Dead’s 16-track studio sound collage.


For more information, please visit us at our website: www.barbedwirewhippingparty.com

YOUR IMPACT

The funds we raise here are going directly to the material costs for building our set and costumes.  The entire team is donating our time, talent, and limited resources, including flying ourselves across the country on our own dime to implement the vision.  We are still emerging artists, though, and that means we need your help!


We are reaching out to our friends, family, strangers, and fellow fans of the Grateful Dead:


If you can give big, please do.  $100 funds a costume.  $250 funds a tree in the Razor Blade Forest.  If you can't give big, give small. Small donations add up!  If you can't give at all, please spread the word to others by email, Facebook, Twitter, or good old word of mouth!  The more people who know this project is happening the better!


We are currently scheduled on the ArtsWalk calendar, a cast of 30 performers are currently rehearsing, and we will implement this project to the best of our ability with the funds raised with your help.  Our goal is to do this piece justice, especially as it is being done with Robert Hunter's blessing.  Your support is critical to making this happen!


BEYOND ARTSWALK

Our goal for this particular fundraising campaign is $7,000, but our overall goal is $10,000.


If we can raise $10,000 and if the community is receptive to the experience, we hope to tour a version of Barbed Wire Whipping Party around the nation, installing the experience in various cities and ending at Burning Man 2012.  How this project evolves, and what it becomes, depends on you.


Thanks for your support!


The Barbed Wire Whipping Party Team

story:
We are a group of emerging L.A. artists and we want to have a show. We've been working hard, and the work is good -- but no one knows about it.  Getting into galleries is difficult for emerging artists, so we’re going to stage our own pop-up event. Putting on a show is expensive, so we need your help!

We need money to rent a gallery space in one of L.A.’s gallery districts, with high ceilings and lots of foot-traffic. We also need money for insurance and publicizing the show.

em.bod.y is happening this summer, regardless of how well-funded we are.  But with your help we can host it in a prime location and really do it right.

If you like our work, and would like to help us start our careers and get this work seen -- help us out!

 

 Eric Pedersen, "The Untitled Painting of Jonny Sleeping"

  

Richard Morris, "Sarah Being Led"

 

Please have a look in the gallery to see more of our work!

 

(Note: not all of the work displayed here will be at the show, but expect to see new work!)

 

em.bod.y is:

  • Alex Douziech
  • Matthew Durante
  • Jonny Hart
  • Michael Hubbard
  • Amanda Mears
  • Richard Morris
  • Margaret Ouchida
  • Eric Pedersen
  • Peter Zhang

story:
Introduction
Hello! My name is Jenniferraye Patterson and I am a Freelance Illustrator that gains inspiration from Movies, TV Shows, Plays, and mostly Video Games (Role-playing ones win my heart always). Just recently, I have taken a liking to attending conventions to expose my name a bit more. Not only have I grown fond memories in doing so at my first two in California (AM2 and Anime Expo) but I've decided to broaden my horizons a bit more - technically at Comikaze Expo first. What better way to take this next stage of promoting my work to a convention beginning near my home in Los Angeles?


What I Need | What You Get

Comikaze Expo begins on September 14-15, and this two-day convention is hosted by the legendary Marvel Creator Stan Lee. If anything, I would like to merge my art with the opportunity to table at Stan Lee's convention, and God willing, handing him my work as a thank-you to being an instant inspiration to this newly-crafted project. And whoever has the heart to help me achieve this goal through any type of contribution (spreading the word, donating, etc.,) will have my eternal thanks and more.

This whole project will be 100% self-made with your funds: Art prints will be printed in my small office, and pins/keychains will be molded on my living room table. All I ask for is at least $2500 to afford everything - two sets of button machines | an Epson WorkForce Printer | and an Artist Alley Package to Comikaze Expo as well as the funds for the conventions soon to come: Pacific Media Expo, AnimeiCon, Anime Los Angeles, and MegaCon. Anything you give, even a dollar, will give you something a small as a Thank You Note + Keychain or as big as a Deluxe Print & Pin Collection for your collective needs and walls. Please review my Updates for information on perks - Art Print previews and gallery updates will be updated every 5-7 days. The hands that help will not go unnoticed!

In Conclusion
Again, and I don't mean to sound like a pest, but for any of your contributions towards this Project as I branch out to Comikaze and other conventions, I promise to use wisely. It's hard enough to no longer attend college because I'm not "rich" enough for 40K tuition, and only being self-employed at home causes me to go so far in my life. View my work here or at deviantART! If you think my work is good enough to see the world, I encourage you to contribute.

 

Even if the $2500 is not met, I will still use every penny given wisely.

story:
Durante los últimos 12 años, el Festival del Tesechoacán ha promovido el intercambio musical entre diversas regiones culturales  de nuestro país y el mundo, realizándose siempre en espacios abiertos y gratuitos que permitan a la población local conocer algo más de la diversa riqueza de tradiciones que en nuestro México existen.

A través de conciertos, proyecciones, pláticas, talleres, exposiciones y presentaciones editoriales; el Festival propicia el acercamiento de todas las generaciones de nuestro pueblo a la cultura del país, además promueve la participación de la ciudadanía no sólo con su asistencia a los eventos, sino también a través de su aportación económica, en especie o en su organización, lo que ha permitido que el festival se mantenga como un espacio comunitario de convivencia.

Este año, el Festival requiere de tu apoyo para el financiamiento de sus actividades y te invitamos a que nos ayudes a alcanzar la meta de recaudación de fondos, que complementen lo que la población aporta. El total de lo recaudado será utilizado en el apoyo para traslados de los grupos participantes en el escenario del Festival, en tres noches de conciertos gratuitos para todo público.


Over the past 12 yearsFestival del Tesechoacan has promoted the musical exchange among different cultural areas in Mexico and the world, always performing in open spaces and free,  so  local people get to know better the  richness of our traditions.

Through concerts, screenings , lectures , workshops , exhibitions and book presentations; Festival promotes the approach of all generations of our people to the country's culture also promotes citizen participation not only attending events , but also through their financial contribution, in kind or the organization itself. It has allowed the festival to remain as a community living space .

This year, the Festival needs your support to finance their activities.We invite you to help us toreach the target of fundraising to complement what the population provides. Total amount will be used to pay transportation of the artists who  will be performing in the festival for three nights of free concerts.

El festival es un emotivo esfuerzo por compartir la cultura musical tradicional de nuestra región con la mayor cantidad de culturas posibles y enriquecerlas mutuamente. En su escenario han desfilado ya un importante número de grupos de México y América, como Cenzontle (E. U. A.), La Familia Duarte (Paraguay), Chico Trujillo (Chile), Alegrías de a peso (Argentina), Mono Blanco, Los Vega, Los Utrera, Los Cojolites, entre otros importantes exponentes del son jarocho tradicional, Mariachi Tradicional Charanda (México DF-Michoacán), solo por mencionar algunos. Puedes conocer un poco de lo presentado en el festival en el Sound Cloud del Festival: http://soundcloud.com/festivaldeltesechoacan

Como todos sabemos, México, Veracruz y nuestro municipio se encuentran viviendo una situación histórica en donde esfuerzos como el festival y los talleres de música y creación artística en comunidades como la nuestra, toman mucha relevancia para los niños de la zona ofreciendo una alternativa de vida distinta a la migración o al crimen organizado.

Recuerda que con cada dólar que aportes al proyecto, nos ayudarás a que el Décimo Tercer Festival del Tesechoacán tenga más difusión y que el servicio a los artistas participantes y espectadores sea más acogedor y cálido.

Ven y conoce más del proyecto en nuestras redes sociales y página web: http://www.facebook.com/festival.tesechoacan,

http://www.festesechoacan.com 

http://www.twitter.com/FestTesechoacan

The festival is an emotional effort to share the traditional musical culture of our region with the greatest possible number of cultures and enrich each other. Our stage has  been visited by manyMexican and Latin American bands as Cenzontle (USA), La Familia Duarte (Paraguay), Chico Trujillo (Chile), Alegrias de a peso (Argentina), Mono Blanco, Los Vega, Los Utrera, Los Cojolites, among other important exponents of traditional son jarocho, Mariachi Tradicional Charanda (Mexico DF-Michoacan), just to mention a few. You can listen some of them in our Sound Cloud:

http://soundcloud.com/festivaldeltesechoacan

As we all know, Mexico, Veracruz and our town are living a historical situation where efforts as the festival, music workshops and artistic creation in communities like ours, take much relevance for children in the area, offering an alternative lifestyle different migration or organized crime.

Remember that every dollar contributed to the project, will help to the 13th Festival del Tesechoacán have more outreach, also the service provided to participating artists and spectators will make them feel more confortable.

Come and learn more about the project on our social networks.

http://www.facebook.com/festival.tesechoacan http://www.festesechoacan.com

http://www.twitter.com/FestTesechoacan



Sabemos que al hacer este tipo de acciones corremos riesgos y debemos superar desafíos, en caso de no superar la meta fijada en esta campaña el Festival  reducirá el número de artistas participantes, por lo cual tendremos que reorganizar las actividades.
En el caso de superar la meta, tendremos un festival como el que está planeado. Pronto estaremos subiendo el cartel en las actualizaciones de la campaña.

We know that by doing this kind of actions we take risks and challenges we must overcome, if not exceed the target set in this campaign the Festival reduce the number of participating artists, so we will have to reorganize activities.

In the event of exceeding the goal, we will have a festival like that is planned. Soon we will be raising the poster campaign updates.


 


Si no puedes colaborar económicamente con nuestro proyecto, es de mucha ayuda que compartas esta campaña de fondeo en tus redes sociales y con tus amigos.
La difusión es una acción que beneficia a nuestro festival. ¡Gracias por apoyar las inciativas ciudadanas!

If you can not collaborate economically with our project, its very helpful to share thisfunding campaign in your social networks and to your friends.

Diffusion is an action that benefits our festival. Thank you for supporting citizens initiatives!

story:
There is more than meets the eye when it comes to tops. Believe it or not, there is even science that explains how a top can increase creativity, enhance your thought process, educate you, and even make you feel at peace and relax.

We believe it's more simple than science! In a digital world, a “real interaction” matters.Especially a real interaction with real materials, in this case pure solid metals.

DESK COMPANION

Tops make for a great desk companion - perhaps you need a little brainstorming boost after long hours behind your computer or you simply want to de-stress a bit. 

SPIN COMPETITIONS

Spin a top when with friends, family or coworkers and you’d be surprised as to how much attention spinning tops create! Engage in some friendly competitions to see who is crowned Spin Champion! Best of all, since all of our spinning tops made from the same metal are identical, you can challenge anyone worldwide!

ORIGINAL GIFTS 

A great original gift - really, when was the last time you thought of a “spinning top” - that is designed to last Forever. We love technology too, but unlike electronics that get replaced every few years, a true piece of art with no buttons, no batteries, no screens will remain valuable and in style forever.

CRAFTED ART AND PURE METALS 

Learn about the colors, weights and characteristics of the metals and of our tops! Learning can be both fun and beautiful. Much of our international family just loves finely-crafted art!

ForeverSpin™ tops are made in Canada and are CNC-machined on aerospace-grade lathes from one solid piece of metal for ultimate precision and quality. We meticulously check each and every spinning top to ensure that only perfect tops receiving a serial number and carry the ForeverSpin™ seal.

STANDARD OF QUALITY AND MANUFACTURING


We have been making tops for years and our manufacturing process has continuously evolved in our pursuit of excellence - it is rare to find the level of precision that we achieve in regular everyday objects and you’ll instantly notice the symmetry and texture upon touching our tops for the first time! We actually dedicated a large portion of our research and development to surface finish to improve the overall touch and feel.

A NEW EXPERIENCE - SILICA GLASS SPINNING BASE

We have managed to engineer silica glass to achieve not only an extremely hard surface, but a low coefficient of friction.


Why is this important? At ForeverSpin, we believe in an overall experience rather than just numbers and we work very hard every day to improve your experience. The experience of spinning a top on the new Forever Base is so much more fulfilling: faster stabilizing, less scratches, and longer spins! 

OUR NEW METALS

MAGNESIUM

Magnesium is the lightest metal in our collection! Half the weight of our lightest spinning top and an incredible 10x lighter than the tungsten top, this metal weighs even less than some plastics! We want the world to experience this ultra-light solid metal. Have you ever held a solid piece of magnesium in one hand and a piece of tungsten in the other? The weight difference is mind-blowing! Aside from the weight, you'll love the color and how playful it is.

Words that describe Magnesium: Nimble - Playful -Ultra light

DAMASCUS STEEL

Dating back to the 3rd century, Damascus steel is fabricated by forging layers of steel together to create beautiful intrinsic patterns of steel. Due to the forging process, the production of this metal is incredibly labour-intensive. The same process makes the metal very hard, making it a favorite in ancient weapon crafting and especially in the production of swords. Since the fabrication of material is done by hand, no two damascus spinning tops are the same, making your damascus top one of a kind.

Words that describe Damascus Steel: Classic - Epic - Lost in Time

BLACK ZIRCONIUM

An exotic, rare super-metal! In its natural state, zirconium is silvery-grey but creates a natural, beautiful, jet-black oxide layer when heated at high temperatures. This layer makes it incredibly durable and scratch-resistant - its black lustrous finish is very beautiful making this the ultimate black spinning top.

Words that describe Zirconium: Exotic - Rare - Super-metal - Incredibly Hard

SILVER

Silver: Owning a spinning top made from Solid Silver is something very special. Silver possesses very unique properties such as having the highest electrical conductivity, thermal conductivity and highest reflectivity of any metal. Like all of our spinning tops, we CNC-machined this spinning top from a solid block which requires almost one pound of solid silver per top. Silver has a brilliant white metallic luster, is considered a precious metal, and many times, has served as a form of currency. Solid Silver spinning tops are very rare and we are excited to be offering this to our Kickstarter community!


METAL MUSEUM PACKS

MORE PERKS AND ADD - ONS

To add an add-on simply include the Dollar amount in your contribution. 

For example, to add an extra aluminum, You would have to contribute an extra  $34. 

When selecting the perk you can select the “Additional Gift” option and enter a custom amount depending on what you would like to receive. ( Just make sure that it adds up correctly) You can get as many add-ons as you would like simply make sure the amount is totalled correctly.  

Once the campaign is over you will get a survey where we will make note of your options.





Shipping

Regular shipping is included in contribution unless it states to add $6 for shipping. This covers regular untracked shipping anywhere in the world!. 

Other Shipping options such as Tracking Number or Insurance will be offered after the campaign ends for an extra fee (recommended for large or international pledges). The amount will depend on the weight, value of the reward and destination. With backers in over 70 different countries we believe this is the best method, as it allows the backers a higher degree of control over the shipping options, to tailor to their individual needs.

Our website

Visit our website at ForeverSpin.com for more details on each of our items and some cool photographs! Feel free to follow us on our social medias for some more fun stuff as the project progresses!

We love hearing from our backers! Send us an email to info@foreverspin.com , message us on Kickstarter or give us a call at:

1-855-922-SPIN

We're incredibly excited for these new tops and hope that, together, we can revive the world's oldest toy!
story_txt:
There is more than meets the eye when it comes to tops. Believe it or not, there is even science that explains how a top can increase creativity, enhance your thought process, educate you, and even make you feel at peace and relax.We believe it's more simple than science! In a digital world, a “real interaction” matters.Especially a real interaction with real materials, in this case pure solid metals.DESK COMPANIONTops make for a great desk companion - perhaps you need a little brainstorming boost after long hours behind your computer or you simply want to de-stress a bit. SPIN COMPETITIONSSpin a top when with friends, family or coworkers and you’d be surprised as to how much attention spinning tops create! Engage in some friendly competitions to see who is crowned Spin Champion! Best of all, since all of our spinning tops made from the same metal are identical, you can challenge anyone worldwide!
ORIGINAL GIFTS 
A great original gift - really, when was the last time you thought of a “spinning top” - that is designed to last Forever. We love technology too, but unlike electronics that get replaced every few years, a true piece of art with no buttons, no batteries, no screens will remain valuable and in style forever.


CRAFTED ART AND PURE METALS 

Learn about the colors, weights and characteristics of the metals and of our tops! Learning can be both fun and beautiful. Much of our international family just loves finely-crafted art!

ForeverSpin™ tops are made in Canada and are CNC-machined on aerospace-grade lathes from one solid piece of metal for ultimate precision and quality. We meticulously check each and every spinning top to ensure that only perfect tops receiving a serial number and carry the ForeverSpin™ seal.
STANDARD OF QUALITY AND MANUFACTURING


We have been making tops for years and our manufacturing process has continuously evolved in our pursuit of excellence - it is rare to find the level of precision that we achieve in regular everyday objects and you’ll instantly notice the symmetry and texture upon touching our tops for the first time! We actually dedicated a large portion of our research and development to surface finish to improve the overall touch and feel.A NEW EXPERIENCE - SILICA GLASS SPINNING BASE

We have managed to engineer silica glass to achieve not only an extremely hard surface, but a low coefficient of friction.

Why is this important? At ForeverSpin, we believe in an overall experience rather than just numbers and we work very hard every day to improve your experience. The experience of spinning a top on the new Forever Base is so much more fulfilling: faster stabilizing, less scratches, and longer spins! OUR NEW METALS

MAGNESIUM
Magnesium is the lightest metal in our collection! Half the weight of our lightest spinning top and an incredible 10x lighter than the tungsten top, this metal weighs even less than some plastics! We want the world to experience this ultra-light solid metal. Have you ever held a solid piece of magnesium in one hand and a piece of tungsten in the other? The weight difference is mind-blowing! Aside from the weight, you'll love the color and how playful it is.
Words that describe Magnesium: Nimble - Playful -Ultra light
DAMASCUS STEEL
Dating back to the 3rd century, Damascus steel is fabricated by forging layers of steel together to create beautiful intrinsic patterns of steel. Due to the forging process, the production of this metal is incredibly labour-intensive. The same process makes the metal very hard, making it a favorite in ancient weapon crafting and especially in the production of swords. Since the fabrication of material is done by hand, no two damascus spinning tops are the same, making your damascus top one of a kind.
Words that describe Damascus Steel: Classic - Epic - Lost in Time
BLACK ZIRCONIUM
An exotic, rare super-metal! In its natural state, zirconium is silvery-grey but creates a natural, beautiful, jet-black oxide layer when heated at high temperatures. This layer makes it incredibly durable and scratch-resistant - its black lustrous finish is very beautiful making this the ultimate black spinning top.
Words that describe Zirconium: Exotic - Rare - Super-metal - Incredibly Hard

SILVER
Silver: Owning a spinning top made from Solid Silver is something very special. Silver possesses very unique properties such as having the highest electrical conductivity, thermal conductivity and highest reflectivity of any metal. Like all of our spinning tops, we CNC-machined this spinning top from a solid block which requires almost one pound of solid silver per top. Silver has a brilliant white metallic luster, is considered a precious metal, and many times, has served as a form of currency. Solid Silver spinning tops are very rare and we are excited to be offering this to our Kickstarter community!


METAL MUSEUM PACKS


MORE PERKS AND ADD - ONS
To add an add-on simply include the Dollar amount in your contribution. 


For example, to add an extra aluminum, You would have to contribute an extra  $34. 




When selecting the perk you can select the “Additional Gift” option and enter a custom amount depending on what you would like to receive. ( Just make sure that it adds up correctly) You can get as many add-ons as you would like simply make sure the amount is totalled correctly.  
Once the campaign is over you will get a survey where we will make note of your options.






Shipping
Regular shipping is included in contribution unless it states to add $6 for shipping. This covers regular untracked shipping anywhere in the world!. 
Other Shipping options such as Tracking Number or Insurance will be offered after the campaign ends for an extra fee (recommended for large or international pledges). The amount will depend on the weight, value of the reward and destination. With backers in over 70 different countries we believe this is the best method, as it allows the backers a higher degree of control over the shipping options, to tailor to their individual needs.
Our website

Visit our website at ForeverSpin.com for more details on each of our items and some cool photographs! Feel free to follow us on our social medias for some more fun stuff as the project progresses!

We love hearing from our backers! Send us an email to info@foreverspin.com , message us on Kickstarter or give us a call at:
1-855-922-SPIN
We're incredibly excited for these new tops and hope that, together, we can revive the world's oldest toy!

story:
Summary

The Fergus Falls Public Arts Commission (FFPAC) is excited to begin its first major project this spring and summer, and we need YOUR help to make it a reality!

"Freedom," a sculpture designed by Duluth artist Ann Klefstad, will be installed in the new roundabout at Alcott and Tower Road in Fergus Falls. The sculpture, due to be completed by Fall 2015, will stand at 20 feet high and is made of aluminum and steel. It depicts birds in playful flight, reminiscent of “heart stirring” flocks of birds following a tractor in a field during harvest time, according to Klefstad. The sculpture will serve as an expressive and memorable gateway to the city for both residents and visitors, reminding viewers of the environmental and cultural assets that make our region so unique.

The sculpture was chosen through a highly engaged process. In July 2013, FFPAC announced a call for proposals from artists, which attracted 13 proposals from 11 different artists. A community selection committee was formed of 12 people to review all proposals. The group included artists, property owners near the roundabout, business owners, interested citizens, and elected officials. The group met for a total of 8 hours over the course of 1.5 months, closely evaluating and discussing each proposal based on its relevance to the community of Fergus Falls, safety, cost of upkeep, and the experience and credibility of the artists. "Freedom," was the top sculpture recommended to FFPAC based this criteria, and the FFPAC unanimously voted to move forward on making the sculpture a reality.

There are few artists in the state of Minnesota as experienced as Ann Klefstad in designing fabricating high quality, lasting public art. Klefstad’s commissioned work has appeared all around the state of Minnesota, including the Lake Superior Zoo, Columbia Garden Park in Minneapolis, Franconia Sculpture Garden, and at the Harriet Island Plaza, (a project which was given an American Institute of Landscape Architects Merit Award!) Check out our gallery to view some of her finished projects!

What We Need & What You Get

The total project budget for "Freedom" is approximately $40,000. We want at least 25% of that funding to come from people like you, which is why our goal on this site is only $10,000. The rest of the funds needed are being raised through major private donors, businesses, and grant funds. By donating to this campaign, even if it's just a small amount, we're able to show these larger funders that there are people in Fergus Falls who want this project to happen. 

And, crowdfunding is a fun way to support a project in the community, because you get cool gifts! Check out our great incentives, from a limited edition I Heart Fergus Falls Art sticker, to beautiful prints or models of the sculpture that you can display in your home or office! 

Impact

According to the article “Why Public Art Matters,” published by Americans for the Arts, “When we think about memorable places, we think about their icons – consider the St. Louis Arch, the totem poles of Vancouver, the heads at Easter Island. All of these were the work of creative people who captured the spirit and atmosphere of their cultural milieu. Absent public art, we would be absent our human identities.” 

Smaller communities throughout rural Minnesota are struggling to make themselves distinct. What a place looks like is often the first thing people notice or remember when they consider a town’s identity. Public art has been proven to play a big role in making cities and towns places where people want to live and visit.

We believe that placing a beautiful sculpture in a gateway location such as the Tower Road roundabout, immediately sends the message to visitors that Fergus Falls is a community that has pride in its appearance and invests in a positive sense of identity.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, please think to yourself right now if there's someone you know who loves public art that could donate, and share this page with them personally.

And of course, share this page on your social media pages frequently throughout the campaign! We can't do this alone!


Thank you for supporting public art in Fergus Falls!

story:
The Project

The glass cyphers is a new collaborative project between film maker/digital artist Paul Miller and glass artist Griet Beyaert. We are both self-employed artists met in 2013 and found a lot of common ground in our work despite using completely different mediums. This led to us experimenting with small glass sculptures and projected video imagery and exploring the way that the moving light interacted with the intricate form of the glass. The results were immediately exciting and we decided to further develop this work and do more experimenting. 

From this we have developed plans for an installation which will comprise the creation and projection of moving images onto sculpted glass works (around 20 large pieces), suspended above the audience. The digital content will be contained on and inside the glass pieces through the technique of projection mapping which involves creating a complex virtual version of the sculptures to be as a mask for the light, preventing projection outside of the intended piece. The effect as the audience moves in the areas beneath the pieces will be of self-contained, floating light-spaces; the perception of the solidity of objects is removed and new space is created.

The project is due to commence on 24th August 2015 with an intense work schedule culminating in an event over three nights at Left Bank Leeds, UK, a spectacular venue which is a converted church; 9-11th October. 

The Future

In the longer term the work that comes from this will form the basis of what we can take forward so that the pieces, along with documentation of the project and events will help promote our ideas for future installations and commissions; it is envisaged that the collaboration can develop and grow, finding new audiences. The work is also naturally adaptable, giving scope for site-responsive versions in future venues; so the benefit of the project will be ongoing. 

Delivering

This is an ambitious project with a challenging time-frame, which we have carefully planned and scheduled with contingencies for production. Both artists are experienced in producing work and installing complex work in large spaces. 

Support

Your support will help get the project underway, buying materials and glass firings (which will cost a total of £1714 for the full 20 sculptures to be completed). 

When you contribute to the campaign, you don't give something for nothing. At each contribution level, there are perks you receive in return for your contribution.

For Example:
  • Contribute at the £60 level and you will receive a limited edition signed artists' prints from a series of photographed images of the glass projections. 
  • Contribute at the £150 level and you will receive a unique glass work printed with imagery from the projection works.
  • Contribute at the £250 level and you will be invited to Left Bank Leeds during the installation and testing of the work and meet the artists, receive a unique glass work printed with imagery from the projection works and choose a unique still image of the glass projections (output as a signed, one-off print).

Where do the funds go if we don't reach our goal?

Since we have chosen the "flexible funding" option, all contributions will still go towards the project, with a slightly increased fee from Indiegogo. So whatever happens with the campaign, the project will go ahead, tailored to the funding we receive and perks will be distributed to those who made contributions.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute much financially, you can help spread the word about the campaign using Indiegogo's share tool, Facebook sharing, email and word of mouth. Thank you!

The artists

whoispaulmiller.co.uk       grietbglass.com

story:
• Amy Bleu is a Portland-based, nationally touring singer/songwriter and model. Michael Lerch, also based here in Portland, is a photographer, painter and poet unlike any other. Together we are working to create a modern pin up calendar for 2017, filled with original images to that will drip off of the pages with lush colors and vivid feelings. But we need your help! Pre-ordering a copy of the calendar will help this project to see the light of day!
  • Pre-ordering customers will receive a copy of the calendar before 2017. Benefactors simply donating will receive good karma, and big spenders will receive extra perks on top of receiving an autographed copy of the calendar.
  • Pre-order funds, and donations, will go directly toward the printing of this calendar.

story:
Hi! My name is Meghan Hartnett.

I'm a 19 year old woman of the arts, aspiring to get to become a voice actress in the future. For now, however, I simply do my thing: Go to college, Draw as a hobby, Game as a passion, and do small time voice acting gigs online. 

I'm with a wonderful boy by the name of Adam Hale and we've been together for three years. In the next year or so, we want to go on our first real vacation together. We've never gone out of the east coast with each other and would like to change that for a week.

So, we're planning a trip to Disney World in Florida. Big idea, yes. And, honestly, I have no right at all to ask any of you to help us out! That's where the perks come in!

I'm doing commissions to get to Disney!!!

What We Need & What You Get

So here we go guys - Our Goal is to get to 3,000 dollars. (Obviously we'll be working and saving up money from our own jobs, too. But I'm putting a base of three thousand here for simplicity reasons.

You get commissions!

  • Donate 5$ and you get a PENCIL SKETCH
  • Donate 10$ and you get  CHIBI LINE ART
  • Donate 15$ and you get FULLY COLORED CHIBI
  • Donate 20$ and you get LINE ART
  • Donate 25$ and you get DIGITAL MEDIA WORK (Cards[Birthday/Business], Flyers, Logos, Custom Website Background.)
  • Donate 30$ and you get FLAT COLOR 
  • Donate 35$ and you get SHADED IMAGE
  • Donate 40$ and you get FULL SCENE w/BACKGROUND
  • If you want multiple - Add their costs together and make a custom donation - Then email me at MEG.HARTNETT12@GMAIL.COM  with the Subject: Custom Art Commissions - Your Name.
So there you have it! Below are some personal rules and notes...

    Notes

    • Compared to other artists - I'm obviously amateur. But I'll work hard to get what you want. 
    • I can be a slow worker - I'll be honest - But I will get your art to you. College becomes very busy for me with all the homework, the two clubs I'm an officer in, and the work hours I'll be taking on. I ask you patiently wait - but feel free to send me FRIENDLY reminders.
    • I don't do animals. I can do like... plush animals, but if you ask me to draw an animal, you'll be disappointed.
    • I can, however, do nekos and what not. (Just not full furries.)
    • Upon Request I can do my Anime-esque style or my more realistic style. I can also do Cell Shading and Soft Shading. (I'm better at soft shading)
    • I can do nudity - How ever I will not do Hentai.
    • I'll be honest, my backgrounds tend to suck. But I'll try my best. Thanks. 
    • YOU WILL NEED TO SEND ME THE DESCRIPTIONS OF YOUR COMMISSION IN AND EMAIL TO ME. MY EMAIL ADDRESS IS MEG.HARTNETT12@GMAIL.COM. MAKE YOUR SUBJECT LINE: Commission Request - Your Name
    That's it to be honest.
    To all those willing to donate to me and get a commission...
    Adam and I sincerely thank you and appreciate it!

story:
A Traveling Classroom:

This journey requires ordinary, traditional school equipment. Yet, it is the non- ordinary, outside of the box, creative space that has the ability to  transcend an educational experience. Equipped with student desks, a teacher's desk, and a chalkboard all packed up into our truck, we aim to spend three days traveling around the state of Wisconsin. We will be setting up our classroom at various locations and for three full days we will document the process of setting up this classroom through video, photography, writing, sketching, and other artistic mediums. 

Our goal is to generate dialogue with the community, incite educational nostalgia, and capture an artistic expression of the very place that shapes the root of our society as a whole.

After three days of exploration, we will hold a show in Chicago that will display the traveling classroom itself, along with all the artistic renderings that were created during our journey. This show will be raising funds for the very classroom that we were both educated within, Ida Crown Jewish Academy.


Come Experience our Class.

Live Music, Art for Purchase, & Light Drinks & Snacks.

A Donation amount of your choice is required to attend event. ($1.00 - $500,000)  

Place: 4145 Main Street,Skokie,IL 60076

Date: Tuesday, July 22, 2014

Time: 7:30p.m.- 10:00p.m.


About Us: 

Rena Grosser is a Licensed, Board Certified Art Therapist and Certified Child Life Specialist. She completed her Undergraduate Studies at Queens College and received her Masters in Creative Arts Therapy from Hofstra University. Rena specializes in providing art therapy and child life services but has worn many hats throughout her career.  She’s an artist herself and facilitates creativity art classes to children of all ages and is an art instructor at Blistein Institute College for Women. Rena believes in using the creative process as a means for self expression and empowerment.

Ariela Robinson has been teaching High School English for the past 6 years at Yeshivah of Flatbush in Brooklyn, NY. She completed her Undergraduate studies at Rutgers University and received her Masters in Teaching English from Teachers College, Columbia University. Along with teaching, Ariela is also an artist as well and has recently enrolled back at Teachers College as a Doctoral candidate with a focus on interdisciplinary education and creating a curriculum that blends the literary and visual arts. Ariela believes in the creative process as a model and tool that should be used for educational success.

Equipped with student desks, a teacher's desk, and a chalkboard all packed up into our truck, we aim to spend three days traveling around the state of Wisconsin. We will be setting up our classroom at various locations and for three full days we will document the process of setting up this classroom through video, photography, writing, sketching, and other artistic mediums. Our goal is to generate dialogue with the community, incite educational nostalgia, and capture an artistic expression of the very place that shapes the root of our society as a whole.After three days of exploration, we will hold a show in Chicago that will display the traveling classroom itself, along with all the artistic renderings that were created during our journey. This show will be raising funds for the very classroom that we were both educated within, Ida Crown Jewish Academy.Come Experience our Class.Live Music, Art for Purchase, & Light Drinks & Snacks.A Donation amount of your choice is required to attend event. ($1.00 - $500,000)  Place: 4145 Main Street,Skokie,IL 60076Date: Tuesday, July 22, 2014Time: 7:30p.m.- 10:00p.m.About Us:  

Rena Grosser is a Licensed, Board Certified Art Therapist and Certified Child Life Specialist. She completed her Undergraduate Studies at Queens College and received her Masters in Creative Arts Therapy from Hofstra University. Rena specializes in providing art therapy and child life services but has worn many hats throughout her career.  She’s an artist herself and facilitates creativity art classes to children of all ages and is an art instructor at Blistein Institute College for Women. Rena believes in using the creative process as a means for self expression and empowerment.Ariela Robinson has been teaching High School English for the past 6 years at Yeshivah of Flatbush in Brooklyn, NY. She completed her Undergraduate studies at Rutgers University and received her Masters in Teaching English from Teachers College, Columbia University. Along with teaching, Ariela is also an artist as well and has recently enrolled back at Teachers College as a Doctoral candidate with a focus on interdisciplinary education and creating a curriculum that blends the literary and visual arts. Ariela believes in the creative process as a model and tool that should be used for educational success.

story: We're a local grassroots group in Nairnshire campaigning for Scottish independence.  Money raised will be used to buy colourful paint for large Yes signs to counteract the expensive banners which have been put up by the Earl and Countess of Cawdor on their land, which is extensive.  It will also be used for paper, ink, etc for our own leaflets, placards and for any other ideas which come up for use only in campaigning for Scottish independence.

story:
The Crystal Garden art project is one of the main focal points at camp Geological Point of Interest. These Crystal Clusters are designed as an interactive lighting installation that peaks up to 8' tall. Traditionally, the lighting designer uses a controller to manipulate the lights that go along with any concert or other live show. Our design, however, puts the controller into the hands of the participants!  Using infrared technology and Wii-motes, we will give our participants the chance to control the lights, simply by turning and rotating the remotes in their hands. The result is a perfectly synchronized light show that plays off the movements of the crowd, creating a one of a kind and ultimately unique light show every time the music plays!


What We Need & What You Get

All proceeds go toward helping fund camp Geological Point of Interest at the annual non-profit music and arts festival, Apogaea, held in Bailey, Co. No single individual benefits from the proceeds of this fundraiser. Funds will be used for things including but not limited to art structures, sound, equipment maintenance, transport, fuel, swag and more. Please check out our massive list of camp member donated gifts to claim your prize!

Our Impact
GPOI: We are proud to be one of the largest theme camps at this annual non-profit music and arts festival held in Bailey, Co. Creating a unique & interactive environment with intricate art sculptures, a massive sound system, performance art & many other levels of communal space; As artists & people of all skill levels and talents, we come together to be a part of this radical experience that is called 'Apogaea'! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

With the help of some awesome minds at Volt Vision (www.voltvision.com), an all encompassing lighting production company based out of Warren, PA. Frenchy, and his wife Julie have designed something similar to our project and have been assisting us in the procurement and programming for our crystals. Please check out the video to get an idea of what our install will be like and visit their website if you are interested in creating something for yourself!

story:
What is Letters to Trees?

Letters to Trees is what I'm calling my summer mini-tour of the West Coast.  I've been accepted to the Tin House Fiction workshop, held at Reed College in Portland during the month of July.  I also have a few shows tentatively lined up if I can afford to make it out, but it's a big IF.

The workshop costs about $1600 including room and board.  It may seem like a steep price to just go write somewhere I don't live, but there are writers there that I want to learn from.  Steve Almond.  Karen Russell.  Dana Spiotta.  Excellent, accomplished writers all in one place for a week-long intensive that will not only get me feedback on my work from authors I admire, but also allow me to dedicate my undivided attention to a piece of fiction, something I never get to do for that long a period of time uninterrupted by my monotonous (but necessary) office job.

Beyond the cost of the workshop itself, there's air fare for the trip, as well as travel costs to get down to California for the shows I'd like to do.  I'll need your help If I'm going to make this happen, and I want nothing more than to refine my writing in a forest and perform poems for you on the Pacific Coast.

Reasons to donate are endless, but here are just a few:

  • you love and support independent art
  • you love ghost stories and want to read mine
  • you want to see me read perform on the West Coast
  • you want swim in the Pacific Ocean with me
  • you want to send me to Oregon to get rid of me for awhile

All valid reasons to donate.  But if those aren't enough, there will be prizes!

 

What I Need & What You Get

In exchange for the cash to defray travel and workshop costs for my trip to Oregon and California you get:

  • a snail mail smooch for your generosity
  • art handmade by me to treasure for a lifetime
  • limited edition chapbooks unavailable anywhere else in the whole wide world

And if I don't reach my projected goal, you'll get your art no matter what, so there's no reason not to donate!  Any little bit helps, even if it's just the price of a cup of coffee.

 

The Impact

If you've found this page, you've probably read or heard my writing somewhere (if you haven't, come have a look).  I am a working artist, which means I essentially work two jobs: one to pay the bills, and one completely out of love.  My candle is forever on fire at both ends.  Publishing poetry and fiction in literary magazines and journals is not lucrative, and getting the individual attention provided by workshops like this one is invaluable to advancing my craft.  Same goes for performing in new places--every person I've ever spoken to on tour has taught me something about why I am writing.

If I meet my goal, I'll be rewarded with the time and resources to learn more about myself as a writer, and you'll get the satisfaction of knowing you directly supported the career of an artist willing to do whatever it takes to succeed.  But remember, I need your help to get there.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the scratch to donate, please share this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, and wherever you think someone might be interested..

Use the Indiegogo share tools!  It's a simple a single click!

story:
Thank you for visiting, while our campaign may be over we are still accepting backers! Please contact Tara@add-a-handle.com for more info.


WHAT IS IT?

Add-a-Handle is a solution for all!

"Seriously, how?" you say, in that prove it tone.  Didn't you watch the Video? If not scroll up and do so! See, seriously! It's all coming together, right? Add-a-Handle [AAH] can be used in thousands of situations (the video just showed a few), it's all about the design which allows for three practical applications:

*All Add-a-Handles shown are prototypes to show examples of uses. They are not the final design.


It’s that product that if you don't get one, you will have a "AAH" moment one day and say, "Arrghh that #@%*  Add-a-Handle would have worked for this!"

Add-a-Handle is light-weight, about the same as a stick of butter.  So, anyone with Arthritis or health concerns can maneuver it.  Who doesn't love butter? Made in the USA so you know it is sturdy and strong. How strong you ask? Holds up to 30lbs. -  that's strong enough to hold my three year old daughter! 

[Umm, that is JUST a weight reference, though tempting, DO NOT use it on your children!]  We have designed it with two adjustable Velcro Buckle Straps which allow you to securely carry, hook or hold your desired object!  No matter what the shape! Well, as long as the straps fit it; currently, the standard strap size included is 18" but other sizes will be offered, (possibly on here, if/when we hit our “Stretch Goal”). Oh, but there is more! We cannot forget the handy magnet atop the handle. It was added to the design for pure convenience! The magnet will hold your wet paintbrush, can opener, 9-volt battery flashlight, putty knife or whatever your special needs call for!

That is how We Have it Handled  for you! Almost every time I show Add-a-Handle to someone they come up with some other way they would use it, or someone else they know who would find it indispensable.  That's why I am here. I know Add-a-Handle is a useful tool for many; while, it could be an essential aid for others. Add-a-Handle can give them back just a little independence they may have lost. I have seen it first hand. If for no other reason than that, I hope you see Add-a-Handle as the ideal product to fund!


Who does Add-a-Handle help and how?

You! How can we state that without knowing you? Simple, Add-a-Handle covers that many different uses! 

Do you...

paint - trim work? Paint straight from the can and stop wasting money on liners, time on clean-up, all while easing hand cramps.

pour - wine seems to be the favorite.  Attach it to a bottle and be in control again, no more spills, one had on cup and one pouring.

use a utility ladder - carry it without marking up your walls or pinching your hands.  Place the grip inside the tool hole while having your can strapped and transport everything all at once, no more spills or bending over. What else could you hang? Or, close the ladder when you are finished and carry it like a briefcase!

have a special need - whether it is Arthritis, MS, Parkinson's, various cancers, weakness, on crutches or use a rollator we have a use for you!  Be more in control with two of the ways you can use Add-a-Handle: hang it on your hand or grip it! We chose the straps with the most user-friendly buckles, specifically mindful of those with finger dexterity issues. Don't forget, it can initially be attached by someone else then used by you at your convenience!

use an extension ladder - use it as a hook to hang your cords, hoses or whatever. While the ladder is still safely on the ground load up the inverted Add-a-Handle with whatever it is you would need up top. Stand it up and everything is right where you need it, without someone else having to hand it up to you, or you trying to climb the ladder with your hands full! Safety first!

push a stroller - attach to side of stroller and hang bags or use as a hand bar for an older child.  It adds not only peace of  mind that your second child is holding on safely, but it gives them that extra space from the wheel so they don't bump into it.

use the great outdoors as your lavatory - attach as a hook and now your toilet paper remains dry and clean.  Better yet, instead of fumbling in the dark, use the attachable 9-volt battery flashlight to get there, and then clip it to the top magnet - now you can see when you have to go.

use a hospital bed- no more losing items.  Attach a canister, now you don't have to scramble to find your remote, or cell phone or a pen in the sheets, or worse, on the floor!

play outdoor sports - how much did you pay for that bag or that jacket? Don't put them on the ground again, use the handle as a hook and you have a portable, quick and simple solution.  Also good for keeping wandering hands out of reach of valuables and ensuring that you can spot your bag from across the court!

do winter chores - hate getting ice melt on your gloves or hands? Attach a coffee can or such and scoop it up. You can even keep your gloves on!


Add-a-Handle: to pull a family together

This project spans two generations.  Mike Payne is the first generation.  He is the "Inventor" - he has been a bit of a frustrated Engineer all his life.  Not being a book trained designer, he works old school.  He waits for something to annoy him, then he works out a solution.  For the most part it stops there.  He may make a few prototypes, share them with people he likes, then move on to some other irritation. Tara (Payne) Vallin is the second generation.  She gets frustrated when all these great work-arounds just sit around.  This time she decided to do something about it!  She has picked up the gauntlet and is going to prove that a good idea should be shared.  And she will further prove that there is nothing unethical about making some money along the way!

The motivation behind the original design was simple.  Mike is handy around the house: building things, lots of repairs and painting.  He has NEVER liked painting the trim work.  He has found over the years that after not-so-long his hands and fingers would cramp from holding the quart size paint can.  He bought all the gadgets on the market and none of them suited all his purposes - easy to use, easy to clean, easy to store, saves time, saves money- and most important - no annoying stress on his body.  His first solution was to use an empty plastic coffee can.  It was lighter, and the cramping took quite a bit longer to start, but there it was.... The next stage was to pick up the commercial pail that had a handle built in, but his wife never had any single-color paint projects.  So, then there had to be multiple pails and what about all the cleaning in-between as he never remembered the liners when at the store.  Soon after, old beer pitchers started disappearing around the house.  His first prototype showed up about two years ago.  At first, he was content filing the patent paperwork (not his first) and trying to sell the whole kit-and-caboodle to one of the major paint companies. 

Tara on the other hand-le saw the full potential of this latest work-around.  It had so many more practical uses than merely painting trim.  Unfortunately, Tara has had some personal tragedy and has seen first hand what a God-send this solution could be for folks with physical limitations.  But then, as her perspective changed, so did her vision.  No longer limited to paint cans and hospital beds...it became a go-to-tool for so many other everyday uses. She approached Mike and said, "I want to make this happen..." He said, "...run with it!" He filed the final Patent paperwork and they were on their way.


This is what we have done...

Mike made a variety of prototypes early on, and from there Tara did her research,

                  

received tons of feedback and did lots of testing with her own prototypes. Tara, like her Dad, is handy and a problem solver, so she learned how to make her own prototypes. Through the many stages of this process she has been able to make her own temporary molds with a great product called Smooth-On. This allowed her to re-design as needed. It also allowed her to create a number of repeat handles in order to have them tested by people who would most likely use them once commercially available.  It has been very important to make sure they remain practical, comfortable and functional.

   

Tara began working with Eric Fasser a Design Engineer to tweak the Add-a-Handle so that it would be ready to take it to an injection molder and begin production. Once Eric completed the initial drawings several very affordable 3D-prints were made locally by Ed Hebel at Free Thought Designs. 

            

This afforded us the opportunity to experiment with the future assembly of the handle as well as to see and feel the changes that were made quickly and cost-effectively.  As one of our primary goals was to keep the product in the USA, we thought why not keep the product truly local, and start with companies in our home state of NY?  As a single mom this also means Tara could spend more time with her little daughter as well!  Once the material for Add-a-Handle was chosen, it limited the companies available and she began working with one.  They were not the right fit and after months of going back and forth it came to a parting of the ways.  Lessons learned.  But since We Have it Handled, we will keep on trucking along! 

This is where we are at...

Currently, we are engaged in talks with a new local company, and getting their feedback on how to take this full speed ahead. However, we are not limiting ourselves and have quotes from others as well.

We have several goals ahead of us:

  • Secure a new Injection Mold Company, preferably local
  • Create a great following of people who want to see Add-a-Handle succeed - Let's go Viral!
  • Gain media coverage to get the word out
  • Get the Metal Mold made
  • Cast high quality products...here in the USA
  • Display and present at the National Hardware Show, in Las Vagas, May 2015
  • Have our Indiegogo campaign go above and beyond our goal 
  • Get all our amazing backers their Perks!
  • Finalize packaging
  • Begin selling Add-a-Handle via our website and Amazon
  • Acquire purchase orders so Add-a-Handle gets into the brick 'n mortar stores and sells off the shelves!
  • Be another American woman-owned business success story!
  • Start again with our next product…

Crowdfunding is a great means of getting Add-a-Handle the financial support it needs, but it is a lot of work and that is why we have brought in CrowdfundBuzz. We know we cannot do this alone and that is why we also need your support, financially and/or by your word of mouth and posting.  We truly believe that Add-a-Handle can help so many, please Pay it Forward by spreading the word, it might be because of you that someone else gains a little more ease in their day!  


    Where the funds have come from and where your funds will go…

    Tara was a CFO before getting married and is always running the numbers to make sure they work and that this is financially feasible.  Rest assured, the funds will be accounted for and applied to get this product off the ground!

    Currently, Tara has been funding We Have it Handled Corp with her own funds. She had stopped working when she and Guillaume got married.  They were blessed with a beautiful baby girl and the plan was that she would go back to work when the baby turned one.  Unfortunately, Guillaume was diagnosed with terminal cancer the day before their first wedding anniversary. Seven months later Guillaume passed away. Guillaume made sure there were life insurance policies in place, he was always the planner. Seeing the potential success of Add-a-Handle Tara decided to invest her own savings and take the risk.  We hope that this makes you feel confident in doing the same!

    Our goal is set at $28,000; however, we are confident kind people like yourself will help us to soar way passed that! For the people who are new to Indiegogo, if we do not reach our goal they charge a 9% fee plus credit card processing fees.  If/when we do reach our goal, then there is a 4% charge plus processing fees.  We have taken this into account and chosen to go with a lower financial goal so that there is more money in our pocket later. Always plan for the worst when it comes to fees!  We are still waiting on quotes for 1- and 4-cavity molds. Clearly, the less machine time an injection molder spends on your product, the lower per piece price, and then we can offer an economic selling price to the buyer.

    Once we have the mold made we can then start production. We have all the suppliers in place and they are ready and excited about taking what was once an idea through to having a product in your hands! Again, they are all in the USA and we will be using the brand VELCRO® because quality matters to us! So let’s talk money. The minimum order we can place and have a decent price point is for 5000 units. If 5000 or more Add-a-Handles are redeemed in PERKs then we will be ecstatic and ready! Please help make this happen. We will definitely know we are doing something right. Let’s hope that happens, but if not it is ok! Once we have product in our hands we can use them for marketing and sales. We already have small companies that are interested in selling them, but we need funding to get the mold made first.

    Thank you for your funding and support, in advance, and if you have any questions, concerns or words of encouragement please contact us!  Come back soon so you can see our future updates and progress. 

    LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN! Don't forget to "LIKE" us on Facebook!

    Merci Beaucoup :)


    RISKS AND CHALLENGES

    As you have noticed, Add-a-Handle does not have any batteries, cords or need technological upgrades, so no worries about there being an electrical issue, because We Have it Handled!  We want to assure everyone that we will keep you posted with updates here and on our website, www.add-a-handle.com, throughout the campaign.  If you post questions we will be sure to get back to you as soon as possible.
    With all campaigns there is an element of risk.  At We Have it Handled Corp we are able to produce a hand-crafted Add-a-Handle for each PERK redeemed.  If for some reason the support is not fully there, and we cannot get the tooling done right away we will still do our best to fulfill our obligations. You won’t let that happen though, right? That is how committed we are to show our thanks!
