story:
My campaign:

My name is Laura Thoms and I am a letterpress printer, formerly of Austin, TX, now living at the McDonald Observatory, an astronomical observatory in very remote West Texas. In Dec 2018, I got a superbacteria that resulted in hospitalization out here and repeated trips to Austin (440 mi away) for treatment. On the way home from the hospital out here, my car broke down and in Jan 2019 I had to buy a new car. All in all, I am so grateful that I did not die (my blood pressure was at the passing out level from pain when I drove myself 50 miles to the hospital) but as the bills keep coming in, and I am not in a region where it is easy for me to take on extra work, I decided to create an online fundraiser to catch up on the financial suckhole that is my life right now. Currently I have been canceling all extraneous purchases, travel and obligations, and have come to the conclusion that extreme paucity is no way to live and financial stress is hugely detrimental to the creative projects I have lined up for 2019.  I am not entirely comfortable with a straight up gofundme for my medical bills --- so I created some thank you gifts/rewards, for your kindness, and to inspire donations. 

  • $10 gifts get a postcard; 2 for $20 all 4 for $40. I made some postcards of some of my favorite photos of animals you love like Harry & Lily, and of west Texas. They turned out great, and this test run will be the inspiration for more if they sell out.
  • $20 letterpress print. My wonderful former colleague used to listen to an Italian language lesson at work. For weeks it said "there is a fly in my wine glass" which is now the only thing I can say in Italian. I had an illustrator friend make the drawing and printed it letterpress. This is the perfect silly addition to any kitchen or summer patio.
  • $45 artist proof of Lily. I have started to make solar plate prints of my photos of Lily. I love the process and cannot wait to do more. You can be the first to get the limited run of the very first edition printed on Rives cotton paper.

What I Need & What You Get

The details:

  • I am hoping to raise $3000 to pay off my medical bills and catch up on other bills that have fallen behind
  • You can mix and match the reward levels if you want more than one thing.
  • You can donate at a greater level and get a reward. If you want to donate $100 and only get 2 postcards that is fine. We are all Marie Kondo-ing our worlds, so you may not need more stuff. I just want a way to tangibly say "thank you." 
  • Everything is already made -- so the day you donate, your reward will be on its way to you.
  • All funds donated will help me catch up, even if I do not reach my $3000 goal.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a huge difference:

  • I am launching my first printing non profit in the next month, and being free from this financial burden will allow me to focus more fully on this exciting project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help:

  • Please share with our mutual friends and on social media

story:
Hello! My name is Rosario and I am an Italian visual artist and teacher, mainly dealing with drawing, comics and sculpture. I live and work between Berlin and Italy, two places that have deeply inspired this project.

As an artist, I’ve always been spiritually minded and interested in functional artwork. Tarot is a set of playing cards – the origin of which has not yet been demonstrated with a definitive certainty.

Classical Middle Age flair with modern symbolism

It has taken about two years to complete this new tarot deck and it’s been a labor of love. I’ve studied some of the classic Tarot de Marseille decks in order to make my deck faithful and respectful of their most important symbols, colors and the details contained within the Marseille tradition. However, in order for these cards to fit into our contemporary world I’ve made adjustments, with regards to the style of the cards and their meanings.

          

As an example, ‘Le Mat’ or ‘The Fool’ is represented in a refreshing and original way. While it still resembles the classic court jester of the ancient Tarot de Marseille, the version in the New Choice Tarot’s has been converted to a punk character. Given that the main significance of this Arcana is “energy without a clear direction, free from rules or from any idea of establishment”, I thought that its representation as a character at the edge of society would be suitable to a more contemporary concept. 

LGBTQ+ Party scene Fashion inspired

Also other characters’ styles have been modernized, not only for the Major Arcana, but also for the Court Cards: the classical medieval style of the Tarot de Marseille has been infused with an avant-garde style.

This style of outfit has been inspired by the world of Fashion and certain Berliner places: for example, the underground clubbing scene and, in particular, the queer themed parties - an environment where not only music lovers, but also lots of artists of every genre, meet and celebrate the joy of life, wearing their favorite looks.

The 'House God', aka 'The Tower', has the resemblance of a specific Berliner Techno club.

Elegant and distinctive Minor Arcana

Another fundamental characteristic of the ‘New Choice Tarot’ is the symbolism within the Minor Arcana. In fact, for a prompt identification of each card, I’ve decided to substitute the usual baroque elements with some more specific and 'modern' floral decorations: each species of flower has a classical meaning, which refers to the cards particular meaning. This helps to facilitate the reading interpretation more fully.

For example: the III of Pentacles represents "a material investment that has produced its first return, or its first loss". The Veronica flowers allegedly wish a good success in a new business. All flowers' meanings are explained in the guide booklet included with the deck.

Some other examples here:

 

If you love the Tarot de Marseille decks but always wished for them to have a contemporary and fun feel, this is the opportunity to help publish a totally innovative new version!​

Some of the New Choice Tarot in a spread.

 

What I Need & What You Get

You can book your own copy of the New Choice Tarot by backing the featured perk. If you wish to book several copies, then please check out the other perks with multiple decks on sale. The decks will be shipped as soon as they have been printed, once the campaign succeeds.

I appreciate the help of all contributors and, to express my gratitude, I have included some high-quality perks.

The 'Death' New Choice Tarot T-Shirt, available as a perk.

In order for this fantastic project to become a reality, I will need full funding to print 500 Limited Edition copies of my deck. This amount will include all of the high-quality printed images for the perks. Each deck will come in a beautiful box and with a manual of card descriptions.

 

The original drawings, inked and painted with watercolors.

Please spread the word!

This project will only improve when more people become involved. Even if you do not intend to pre-order the deck at this time, please pass on this announcement to your friends, tell your local retailers or people who may be interested, providing links to it from your favorite social networks - Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, email lists, blogs, or simple one-on-one communications.

Thank you for your precious help!

You can have a look at the making-process of the New Choice Tarot by clicking here.

story:
Ethereal is an upcoming multi-medium pop-up exhibit showcasing emerging Asian American artists from the New York metropolitan area. As Asians in America, identity is ever-evolving and ever-changing. Identity is ethereal. To understand ourselves, we seek, we grasp, consciously and unconsciously, and channel our energy into understanding what it means to be human and to be Asian American.

The Reason

In the hopes of documenting a facet of Asian American progress, we’re taking a snapshot of where we are today by hosting a multi-medium pop-up art exhibit. The exhibition will feature art from up and coming Asian American artists within the NYC Metropolitan area. We want it to a gathering filled with visual arts, live performances, short film screenings and food. This two-day exhibit will be a celebration of what the Asian American creative community has to offer. The two-day event will be held in the heart of Greenwich Village August 11th to 12th, 2018. 

When we think of Asian Americans, the arts and creative fields are not the first things that come to mind. We want to help change this perception. We know first hand that there are an incredible amount of artists out there who identify as Asian American and are doing amazing work but are not yet seen or widely known. So we want to be a part of the process of making these artists visible. We also want to help build up a community in order to foster a stronger identity as Asian American creatives. That is why we are making this event multi-medium. By housing many different art forms under the same roof, we will be able to see just how wide the community of Asian American creatives is and hopefully inspire others to get creative as well. We also wish to tackle the meaning of “Asian American” and ask if the term is too limiting to the wide variety of people who identify as such. We hope to let the artists and their work speak for themselves. Many of them have wrestled with their heritage, identity, gender and have explored that on their canvas of choice. But we also recognize that artists belonging to minority groups are more than just their skin color, heritage, or gender identity and should not be limited to only exploring these topics in their artwork. Our hope in creating this event is to make Ethereal an open platform for the artists to voice their message.

What We Need & What You Get

We want this event to be the best possible and to make it accessible for all people to come. That’s why, from the beginning, we were determined to make this event non-ticketed and open to the public. But in order to put on the event the way we envisioned it, and to give the artists the platform they deserve, we need your help.

As for what the funds will be used for - all of the funds from this event will be used to cover the cost of the venue. The venue is located in-between NYU campus, West 4th street station, and Union Square. We chose this venue because we wanted ease of accessibility and ample visibility. To be honest, our total event budget is $15,000. If your beautiful contributions exceed the amount of $10,000, we will be using them to further cover the cost of the event. This includes building the stage, equipment rental for food, and music. We will also be allocating funds to prepare for the next event as well as giving honorariums to our artists. 

• $12,500 for the venue itself for three days, August 10th-12th. This is for the venue alone.
Additional funds will be used to cover:
• Venue insurance
• DJ equipment, barista equipment
• Tables, chairs, van rentals
• Cost of building a stage
• Installation Manager fee
• Merchandise

Located in the heart of Greenwich Village and bordering West Village, our venue is centrally located on 8th street, between 5th and 6th avenue. Across from famous coffee cafe Stumptown Coffee and next door to the well-known Marlton Hotel.


The Venue

 

Located in the heart of Greenwich Village and bordering West Village, our venue is centrally
located on 8th street, between 5th and 6th avenue. Across from famous coffee cafe "Stumptown Coffee" and next door to the well-known Marlton Hotel.

The Impact

We believe our project is valuable because stories are valuable. They are meant to be expressed in every medium possible. These stories are ours to deliver. Specifically, we're trying to share stories of Asian-American lives through the medium of the arts. We believe taking a snapshot such as this event will foster the importance of camaraderie in the community, spur on a greater appreciation of the arts, and inspire the youth to pursue creativity and freedom through the arts. 

Risks & Challenges

I have a great team of people who will ensure your rewards are fulfilled at the end of this project!

About Us

The ideation of Ethereal began in the beginning of 2018 though we long have had ambitions of organizing an Asian American creative community. In February 2018, Wesley Han and David Koh teamed up to put the idea into motion. Gloria Yuen soon joined the team and helped propel our efforts into realizing this project. Photographer Janice Chung and Filmmaker Kimberly Sun Young also assisted with building the project by creating our crowd-funding video and supporting the project from the beginning.

Wesley ‘Ruger’ Han (Event Director)
Wesley is a singer-songwriter. He graduated from Baruch college with a degree in Sociology while minoring in Asian American Studies. One of his passions includes empowering people and gathering people towards a common goal. He was born and raised in Queens, New York. His EP is offered as one of the crowdfunding rewards so be sure to grab a copy while supporting the event! You can listen to his song "For You", which was written from the perspective of his father, here through Soundcloud: 

https://soundcloud.com/hanonyc/for-you​

David Koh (Event Producer)
One of his on-going art projects is the #infinitepainting - an ever-evolving and continuous
artwork formatted and is brought to life through Instagram. You can find the artwork at
@cellestialstudios on Instagram. Prints of the #infinitepainting project are being offered as a
crowdfunding reward so make sure to check out the project and order a print or two!

http://instagram.com/cellestialstudios

Gloria Yuen (Graphic Media Manager)

Gloria is a multifaceted designer with a degree in Accessories Design and Interior Design from FIT. She is passionate to help create more purposeful and thoughtful design for our community. She is currently working on a creating a seasonless unisex eco-friendly fashion brand.

gloriayuen.com

Other Ways You Can Help

We're looking for people to share about this event through word of mouth and social media. Here are our social media links!

http://etherealarts.co
http://instagram.com/etherealarts.co
http://facebook.com/etherealarts.co
story_txt:
Ethereal is an upcoming multi-medium pop-up exhibit showcasing emerging Asian American artists from the New York metropolitan area. As Asians in America, identity is ever-evolving and ever-changing. Identity is ethereal. To understand ourselves, we seek, we grasp, consciously and unconsciously, and channel our energy into understanding what it means to be human and to be Asian American.The ReasonIn the hopes of documenting a facet of Asian American progress, we’re taking a snapshot of where we are today by hosting a multi-medium pop-up art exhibit. The exhibition will feature art from up and coming Asian American artists within the NYC Metropolitan area. We want it to a gathering filled with visual arts, live performances, short film screenings and food. This two-day exhibit will be a celebration of what the Asian American creative community has to offer. The two-day event will be held in the heart of Greenwich Village August 11th to 12th, 2018. When we think of Asian Americans, the arts and creative fields are not the first things that come to mind. We want to help change this perception. We know first hand that there are an incredible amount of artists out there who identify as Asian American and are doing amazing work but are not yet seen or widely known. So we want to be a part of the process of making these artists visible. We also want to help build up a community in order to foster a stronger identity as Asian American creatives. That is why we are making this event multi-medium. By housing many different art forms under the same roof, we will be able to see just how wide the community of Asian American creatives is and hopefully inspire others to get creative as well. We also wish to tackle the meaning of “Asian American” and ask if the term is too limiting to the wide variety of people who identify as such. We hope to let the artists and their work speak for themselves. Many of them have wrestled with their heritage, identity, gender and have explored that on their canvas of choice. But we also recognize that artists belonging to minority groups are more than just their skin color, heritage, or gender identity and should not be limited to only exploring these topics in their artwork. Our hope in creating this event is to make Ethereal an open platform for the artists to voice their message.What We Need & What You Get
We want this event to be the best possible and to make it accessible for all people to come. That’s why, from the beginning, we were determined to make this event non-ticketed and open to the public. But in order to put on the event the way we envisioned it, and to give the artists the platform they deserve, we need your help.As for what the funds will be used for - all of the funds from this event will be used to cover the cost of the venue. The venue is located in-between NYU campus, West 4th street station, and Union Square. We chose this venue because we wanted ease of accessibility and ample visibility. To be honest, our total event budget is $15,000. If your beautiful contributions exceed the amount of $10,000, we will be using them to further cover the cost of the event. This includes building the stage, equipment rental for food, and music. We will also be allocating funds to prepare for the next event as well as giving honorariums to our artists. • $12,500 for the venue itself for three days, August 10th-12th. This is for the venue alone.Additional funds will be used to cover:• Venue insurance• DJ equipment, barista equipment• Tables, chairs, van rentals• Cost of building a stage• Installation Manager fee• MerchandiseLocated in the heart of Greenwich Village and bordering West Village, our venue is centrally located on 8th street, between 5th and 6th avenue. Across from famous coffee cafe Stumptown Coffee and next door to the well-known Marlton Hotel.
The Venue

Specifically, we're trying to share stories of Asian-American lives through the medium of the arts. We believe taking a snapshot such as this event will foster the importance of camaraderie in the community, spur on a greater appreciation of the arts, and inspire the youth to pursue creativity and freedom through the arts. Risks & Challenges
I have a great team of people who will ensure your rewards are fulfilled at the end of this project!About Us

Photographer Janice Chung and Filmmaker Kimberly Sun Young also assisted with building the project by creating our crowd-funding video and supporting the project from the beginning.Wesley ‘Ruger’ Han (Event Director)Wesley is a singer-songwriter. He graduated from Baruch college with a degree in Sociology while minoring in Asian American Studies. One of his passions includes empowering people and gathering people towards a common goal. He was born and raised in Queens, New York. His EP is offered as one of the crowdfunding rewards so be sure to grab a copy while supporting the event! You can listen to his song "For You", which was written from the perspective of his father, here through Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/hanonyc/for-you​David Koh (Event Producer)One of his on-going art projects is the #infinitepainting - an ever-evolving and continuousartwork formatted and is brought to life through Instagram. You can find the artwork at@cellestialstudios on Instagram. story:
Az Azure Reformművészeti Találkozó a Kék Ló csapatának szervezésében megvalósuló rendezvény. Ennek célja, hogy az egyre bővülő, de elsősorban Budapesthez kötődő közösségi-kulturális tér értékeit egy barátságos zalai tanya és egy szomszédos gyönyörű völgy környezetével és embereivel kapcsolatba hozzuk. A kísérleti művészetek, a szabadzene és a kockázatos gondolkodás hirdetésén túl fontos tehát számunkra a meglévő hálózatok (mind az alkotók, mind az alkotások hálózatának) folyamatos újra-formálása – ezt jelentené az elnevezésben a „reformművészet” megjelölés. Így találkozik majd az avante-garde jazz, a helyi ételek, a kortárs rövidfilmek, a szürreális jelmezek és még sok minden más Zalaháshágyon július 5 és 8 között. Terveinkhez komoly inspirációt jelentett az olyan testvérfesztiválokkal való együtt dolgozás, mint az UbikEklektik, vagy a Takatuka.

 

The Azure Reform Arts Gathering is organised by the crew of Kék ló. The purpose of the festival is to bring together the ever-expanding cultural values of different communities that are mostly related to the city of Budapest with the welcoming farm and the beautiful valley of Zala with its pure nature and friendly people. Besides the introduction and spreading of experimental arts, innovative music, free and risky thinking, it has utmost importance for us to constantly re-form the already existing networks (both the network of artists and their works). Therefore we named the festival Reform Art Gathering as we intend to "re-form" art itself. Hence we expose avant-garde jazz music, local food, contemporary short films, surreal costumes and much more all together at Zalaháshágy, July 5-8. For our plans, it was a great inspiration to collaborate with festivals such as UbikEklektik or Takatuka.

story:
About the project

Hello! I’m Yannis, co-founder of animation company NOMINT, based in London, and for the past five months I have been working with some of the best animators and animation directors I know to bring you the World’s First Animated COVID Mask, in support of the children's hospital GOSH, just on time for this year's Giving Tuesday.

If you haven't already, watch the video at the top of this page, which will hopefully make everything clear. I am selling all 400 of the masks used in the video to support the Great Ormond Street Hospital.

In the light of the whirlwind of events that are happening in the world, I hope the masks with their vibrant and whimsical designs will instill hope and positivity, while helping the most vulnerable among us. 

 

Your Support 

Great Ormond Street Hospital (GOSH) in London is dedicated to providing the UK's widest range of specialist health services for children. Since the hospital opened in 1852 they have been committed to carrying out pioneering research to find treatments and cures for some of the most complex illnesses, for the benefit of children here in the UK and worldwide.

By supporting this project you will be helping Great Ormond Street Hospital to benefit their annual fundraising efforts to help support the backlog of procedures and services paused in the wake of the pandemic. A local staple and unfortunately a common visit for many parents across the UK, they rely on the donations of the public to maintain operations, fundraising as much as £100M per year.

 

The Contributing Animation Directors

I partnered with some top animation studios, animators and directors around the world including Giant Ant, Ori Toor, Henrique Barone, Clim Studio, and Rafael Varona, who donated their time and talents to the cause. With the help and advice from one of the best stop-motion animation director Dario Imbrogno, I hope we managed to transform the mask--now a commonplace and lifesaving accessory in our society--into a beautiful and optimistic canvas of creative expression. 

 

RAFAEL VARONA

HENRIQUE BARONE

CLIM STUDIO

GIANT ANT

ORI TOOR

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word to your friends and colleagues across social media channels would be a massive help :)

Keep up with Yannis’ great future ideas on Youtube

Follow NOMINT for all things animation on Instagram and Facebook

 

*DISCLAIMER*

Please note, these are not a medical-grade masks and are not intended as a replacement for medical-grade personal protective equipment (PPE), nor do we make any claims about their effectiveness. Although this product is raising money for Great Ormond Street Hospital Charity, it is not in any way endorsed by GOSH. 

 

Thank you for your time!

Yannis and Friends

story:
Who are we?

The Last Archive was founded in December 2012 by Vlad Basalici, an artist who lives and works in Bucharest, Romania.  This archive contains newspapers from all over the world that were published on December 21st  2012, the day that had been predicted to be the last day before the Apocalypse.  The newspapers were gathered after a public call with the generous support of people from different continents, who sent journals published in their countries.


The point of interest for The Last Archive is not the apocalypse itself, but rather the relationship between the end of the world and the news. We ask ourselves what the role of mass media is: to exacerbate or to exhaust the novelty of the end of all things?

These are strange times when newspapers are soon to be extinct, being replaced instead by the internet as the source for news. It isn’t yet the apocalypse for newspapers, but we can see everywhere the signs of the end for the printed era.


What is our goal?


The birth of the Last Archive is the first part of the project.  For the second part of the project, we want to invite an artist who will create an art installation in relation with the Last Archive. Because we are part of the world of art, we understand how important it is  that an artist to be paid for his work.  We want his project to be realized and installed in proper conditions.Therefore, we want to give him proper financial support. This artist will be chosen after a public call. His work will be realized during a residency in Bucharest.

The exhibition is scheduled to be opened on  December 2013, at tranzit.ro/Bucuresti , a nonprofit space dedicated to contemporary art from Bucharest. The space is part of tranzit.org, a network working independently in Austria, the Czech Republic, Hungary, Slovakia and Romania since 2002.



Who is involved in this project?

Vlad  Basalici is a visual artist and a performer who lives and works in Bucharest.  In his projects, he investigates how we perceive temporality.  His works, as a solo artist or in collaboration, have been presented at Explore Festival, Alternative Film/Video Festival Belgrad, Dansehallerne, Copenhagen, Alert Studio Bucharest, Paint Brush Factory Cluj Napoca, Introspection Center Bucuresti, National Dance Centre Bucharest

Raluca Voinea is an art critic and curator based in Bucharest. She studied Art History and Theory in Bucharest (1997-2001) and Curating Contemporary Art in London (2004-2006). She is the curator of the Romanian Pavillion at the Venice Biennale in 2013. Voinea has been a co-editor of IDEA. Art + Society Romania, since 2008. She is one of the directors of tranzit.ro, which was recently launched in Iasi, Sibiu, Cluj and it is open from autumn 2012 in Bucharest.

tranzit.ro was founded in 2012 at the initiative of ERSTE Foundation, thus becoming the fifth member of tranzit.org, a network of independent, non-profit organisations from Austria, the Czech Republic, Hungary and the Slovak Republic.

tranzit.ro has the particularity of being itself a network activating in three permanent spaces in the cities of Iasi, Cluj and Bucharest. Through a wide range of activities, experimenting with different working and collaboration methodologies, tranzit.ro wishes to establish itself as an innovative platform dedicated to contemporary art.


How will your support be used?

In order for this to happen, we need your support. Our expenses include:

1. Artist fee

2. Accommodation during residency

3. Travel expenses

4.Production of the work of art

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't make a financial contribution, it doesn't mean you cannot help us. You can also give your support by spreading the word about our project. It will be a great help for us if you would write about our project in your art magazine, blog, facebook, twitter, tumblr .etc. Please share our project.

 Site | Facebook | Twitter  | Google+ | Diaspora

story:
My name is Andrea Fuenzalida, otherwise known as Drea.
Thank you all for viewing my campaign.

An international artist (Australian born with Chilean family origin) working from my studio apartment located in San Francisco, California. I am a dream-time painter; painting a positive idea of reality into the future and need your help to create more art, be a lot more involved in community projects, network and share with the world.


Skilled in digital and traditional arts mostly painting, illustration and graphics, I also have experience with sculpture and hand sewn crafts.

The main purpose of my art is: universal healing, spiritual cleansing and positive strengthening of each individual soul as well as the community.  Depicting connections of the spiritual and physical realms, the ancient combined with the modern, creating images of beauty with intense colors and sharp line-work which I intend to bring feelings of strength, joy, inspiration and upliftment to people of all ages and origins of earth.



Two years ago I quit my day job to focus full-time on my art career. Have been surviving on a minimal budget, selling fine art, taking commissions and graphics services to those mostly independent businesses in my immediate community network. Extreme Inflation in the price of living and some of my equipment going out of commission has stunted my career and ability to be involved in community projects. Right now I really need a financial boost to fully focus on my fine art, produce more powerful dream-time paintings & designs, contribute as much as possible to the SF arts and cultural community, network and share what's happening with the world.

Everyone who donates to this fundraiser will be cherished for eternity as one of the people who helped me advance on solid ground.



PERKS!

CHECK FOR UPDATES TO SEE PERKS BEING CREATED

Anyone who donates and has a website where you share your talents, I will love to post your link on my blog and share on my social networks.

Donations of $5 or more will get you something tangible from me in the mail.

Supporters of $20 or more will receive some form of my original fine art work or hand-made craft.

Very small works and hand-made crafts are rarely ever seen online as they are usually sold in person shortly after they are made.
For those interested in owning original paintings, you will be getting FIRST DIBS ON NEW WORK!
To protect your investments acrylic paintings are all done with UV and Waterproof paint.

These Voodoo Dolls are available in $80 and $1000 perk reward packages.


If you want two of the same type of item or more than one different perk indiegogo lets you donate as many times as you want and choose your perk as quantities allow.
Those who donate twice at $20 or more will get a free bonus gift.

Creation of most rewards including thank you art and color page will be created during and after this fundraiser with all my supporters in mind.

As funds become available completion and fulfillment of rewards will become my number one priority. Contributions through pay-pal will definitely help a lot to speed up the process of sending out perks.

Am very excited to share my artworks with you.

The highest perk package for one extremely generous supporter of $2000, includes one custom made graphic for use in your independent business endeavors with all rights going toward your business. This works great for those who not only want to invest in and support my original art creations but also need a beautiful and professional custom graphic or illustration to use in their own commercial endeavors. That person will also receive an original painting of mine to have in their home or office.

To make sure everyone receives their perks, those who donate please include your email and for those who's rewards need to be shipped please include your shipping address as well. I look forward to sending them to you.

FREE PERK!!! for $0.00 take a moment to share my campaign with your network, I will definitely return your kindness by giving thanks and sharing your endeavors as well. If money is raised due to your networking be prepared to receive a free perk!!!! (size and value depends on amounts raised)

ANY AMOUNT of money raised regardless of set goal, will go a long way in helping me pay my bills and keep making art work on a full-time basis. It will be used first for the fulfillment of all perk packages, basic living expenses, much needed art tools, basic equipment and supplies.

Reaching the goal would secure me 3 months of time to create art, it will also enable me to create simple marketing material, expand my professional network, do more art shows, participate in and promote more artists as well as community art projects and cultural events. Also will give me a small but adequate budget to hire a local photographer to take some good quality images of larger size paintings and more intricate hand-sewn crafts. (As you can see these pictures below taken by me are not very good at all)


Projected Budget Breakdown:

-Three months rent at current rent controlled studio apartment in San Francisco = $3243
-Three months of other living expenses, food, bills (phone/internet/PG&E)...etc = $1000
-New Computer (This one wants to burn out any day now) = $1000
-Professional Quality Wacom Tablet digital pen. = $500
-Awards shipping and materials with enough to cover both domestic and international supporters = $500
-Painting and craft-making supplies as needed, wood, canvas, brushes, paints, fabric, wool, beads, buttons...etc. = $500
-Marketing Materials (stickers, business cards, display tags), reliable web hosting service for home page, gallery/vendor space fees, associated local (within San Fransisco Bay Area) travel costs as needed (taxi/driver, bus and/or subway to client locations and shows)  = $800
-Local Photographer for larger paintings and more intricate hand-made crafts = $400

Total Goal = $7943

I have rounded up some expenses to cover indiegogo and paypal fees. Will be budgeting the best I can so there will hopefully be some left over money to put back into the community. Some technology such as Wacom tablet are already dropping in retail price so that already helps a lot. Also I buy many supplies at local shops when I can to support local small businesses.

If the goal is surpassed; the extra funds plus any earnings I make during that time period will be put toward future living expenses, art related needs as well volunteer much more of my time to network, share, educate and support other artists, local business and non-profit endeavors such as those in SF community and here on indiegogo.

MONEY OR NO MONEY I ALWAYS DO WHATEVER I CAN TO SUPPORT CULTURAL ENDEAVORS, LOCAL BUSINESSES AND OTHER ARTISTS IN MY COMMUNITY. If I'm not stressed about bills I can do a lot more.

If I hit 150% of goal Bonus gifts for all supporters will be created and given.
If I hit 200% of goal I will donate at least $2500 plus more art to local non-profits organizations (Haight-Asbury Street Fair, Paths of Native Africa, The Abigail Cafe, Homeless Advocacy Project, Hyde Street Community Services)

Once my fine-art career is fully solidified; my future goals are to be able to take some time to travel, visit family and friends where I can take the opportunity to collaborate, work, learn and share with artists of other culture and local communities in other parts of the world (examples, Valle de los Artistas, Chile and Aspen Lodge in Estes Park, Colorado).
http://www.az-deco.com/2012/09/el-valle-de-los-artistas-chile.html
http://www.aspenlodge.net/
MY FRIENDS AND CLIENTS AT ASPEN LODGE RECENTLY GOT CAUGHT IN A FLOOD AND LANDSLIDE! :( :( :(
http://www.aspenlodge.net/index.php/news/198-restore-aspen-lodge

For those of you friends and family around the world who have been wanting to buy Drea a coffee, lunch, dinner, drink..etc. but have no time and/or are too far away, now is your chance. All of your small change combined can add up to a lot of financial relief.

Your contributions will really make a huge difference in this stage of my career and in-turn will also help strengthen several cultural community group endeavors with my presence, support and collaboration (current SF Bay examples include, the African Outlet Experience performances and the future Abigail Cafe which stemmed from Abigail the Rock Opera).
http://theafricanoutlet.org/
http://abigailthesalemwitchtrialsrockopera.bandcamp.com/

I also look forward to helping community group projects and other artists with the experience I gain from having this fundraiser.

For those who want to help but are unable to donate online monetary support, you can still help me out a lot by spreading the word about my art and this fundraiser on your social networks. Am very happy to network and share with any of you.

Indiegogo has share tools at the top of this description which you can use or just copy and paste this address http://igg.me/at/dreasart/x/4372003
into any of your social networks or email.

My website is at www.moonsquirrel.com and you can also visit my facebook Artist page at www.facebook.com/dreasart both sites have examples of my art work as well as work I have done for clients.
For those who enjoy tweeting, see you at https://twitter.com/DreaArtist

ALSO I ENCOURAGE ANYONE TO SUPPORT ANY LOCAL ARTS, CREATIVE, CULTURAL AND COMMUNITY EVENTS IN SAN FRANCISCO.
We have so many non-profit cultural events, street-fairs and talented creative artists and great local businesses which need support from people all over the world to stay afloat. The cultural/artistic community in SF wants to provide not only residents but the world of visitors with the most fantastic and original experiences in their lives.

Thank you once again for taking your time to view and read about my art fundraiser and thank you to everyone at Indiegogo for making this possible.

A BIG HEART TO YOU ALL FROM DREA IN SFCITY!
story_txt:
My name is Andrea Fuenzalida, otherwise known as Drea. Thank you all for viewing my campaign. An international artist (Australian born with Chilean family origin) working from my studio apartment located in San Francisco, California. I am a dream-time painter; painting a positive idea of reality into the future and need your help to create more art, be a lot more involved in community projects, network and share with the world.
Skilled in digital and traditional arts mostly painting, illustration and graphics, I also have experience with sculpture and hand sewn crafts. The main purpose of my art is: universal healing, spiritual cleansing and positive strengthening of each individual soul as well as the community.  Depicting connections of the spiritual and physical realms, the ancient combined with the modern, creating images of beauty with intense colors and sharp line-work which I intend to bring feelings of strength, joy, inspiration and upliftment to people of all ages and origins of earth.
Two years ago I quit my day job to focus full-time on my art career. Have been surviving on a minimal budget, selling fine art, taking commissions and graphics services to those mostly independent businesses in my immediate community network. Extreme Inflation in the price of living and some of my equipment going out of commission has stunted my career and ability to be involved in community projects. Right now I really need a financial boost to fully focus on my fine art, produce more powerful dream-time paintings & designs, contribute as much as possible to the SF arts and cultural community, network and share what's happening with the world.Everyone who donates to this fundraiser will be cherished for eternity as one of the people who helped me advance on solid ground.
PERKS!CHECK FOR UPDATES TO SEE PERKS BEING CREATEDAnyone who donates and has a website where you share your talents, I will love to post your link on my blog and share on my social networks.Donations of $5 or more will get you something tangible from me in the mail.Supporters of $20 or more will receive some form of my original fine art work or hand-made craft.Very small works and hand-made crafts are rarely ever seen online as they are usually sold in person shortly after they are made. For those interested in owning original paintings, you will be getting FIRST DIBS ON NEW WORK!To protect your investments acrylic paintings are all done with UV and Waterproof paint.These Voodoo Dolls are available in $80 and $1000 perk reward packages.
If you want two of the same type of item or more than one different perk indiegogo lets you donate as many times as you want and choose your perk as quantities allow.Those who donate twice at $20 or more will get a free bonus gift.Creation of most rewards including thank you art and color page will be created during and after this fundraiser with all my supporters in mind. As funds become available completion and fulfillment of rewards will become my number one priority. Contributions through pay-pal will definitely help a lot to speed up the process of sending out perks.Am very excited to share my artworks with you.The highest perk package for one extremely generous supporter of $2000, includes one custom made graphic for use in your independent business endeavors with all rights going toward your business. This works great for those who not only want to invest in and support my original art creations but also need a beautiful and professional custom graphic or illustration to use in their own commercial endeavors. That person will also receive an original painting of mine to have in their home or office.
To make sure everyone receives their perks, those who donate please include your email and for those who's rewards need to be shipped please include your shipping address as well. I look forward to sending them to you.FREE PERK!!! for $0.00 take a moment to share my campaign with your network, I will definitely return your kindness by giving thanks and sharing your endeavors as well. If money is raised due to your networking be prepared to receive a free perk!!!! (size and value depends on amounts raised)ANY AMOUNT of money raised regardless of set goal, will go a long way in helping me pay my bills and keep making art work on a full-time basis. It will be used first for the fulfillment of all perk packages, basic living expenses, much needed art tools, basic equipment and supplies. Reaching the goal would secure me 3 months of time to create art, it will also enable me to create simple marketing material, expand my professional network, do more art shows, participate in and promote more artists as well as community art projects and cultural events. Also will give me a small but adequate budget to hire a local photographer to take some good quality images of larger size paintings and more intricate hand-sewn crafts. (As you can see these pictures below taken by me are not very good at all)
Projected Budget Breakdown:-Three months rent at current rent controlled studio apartment in San Francisco = $3243-Three months of other living expenses, food, bills (phone/internet/PG&E)...etc = $1000-New Computer (This one wants to burn out any day now) = $1000-Professional Quality Wacom Tablet digital pen. = $500-Awards shipping and materials with enough to cover both domestic and international supporters = $500-Painting and craft-making supplies as needed, wood, canvas, brushes, paints, fabric, wool, beads, buttons...etc. = $500-Marketing Materials (stickers, business cards, display tags), reliable web hosting service for home page, gallery/vendor space fees, associated local (within San Fransisco Bay Area) travel costs as needed (taxi/driver, bus and/or subway to client locations and shows)  = $800-Local Photographer for larger paintings and more intricate hand-made crafts = $400Total Goal = $7943I have rounded up some expenses to cover indiegogo and paypal fees. Will be budgeting the best I can so there will hopefully be some left over money to put back into the community. Some technology such as Wacom tablet are already dropping in retail price so that already helps a lot. Also I buy many supplies at local shops when I can to support local small businesses. If the goal is surpassed; the extra funds plus any earnings I make during that time period will be put toward future living expenses, art related needs as well volunteer much more of my time to network, share, educate and support other artists, local business and non-profit endeavors such as those in SF community and here on indiegogo. story:
Scroll down for English version!

Alle Perks als Foto oder Entwurf abgebildet auf www.kosmos-gesellschaft.org

Träumt Ihr auch vom Weltall? Oder kennt einen Weltraumfan? Dann ist die Kosmosgesellschaft genau das Richtige für Euch! Die Kosmosgesellschaft ist eine fiktive Gesellschaft, die von Künstlerin Christine Niehoff als Kunstprojekt ins Leben gerufen wurde mit dem Ziel, eine wirkliche Plattform für alle wirklich wichtigen Fragen zur Zukunft der Menschheit im Weltall zu schaffen, vom ganz Alltäglichen bis hin zum total Schrägen. Amy Alexander ist ebenfalls Künstlerin und Kandidatin für die Mars One Mission, die Mission zum Mars ohne Rückfahrkarte!

Wir haben schon ein großartiges Logo, aber für den Launch der Gesellschaft Ende November im Rahmen von Christines Einzelausstellung im Kunstraum Potsdam brauchen wir als “ordentliche” Gesellschaft natürlich auch Merchandise! Und dafür brauchen wir Euch! Für Eure Unterstützung gibt bekommt Ihr exklusiv als Erste Zertifikate, Kullis, Tassen, Taschen und Originaldrucke! Jede kleine Hilfe zum Startkapital ist willkommen! Und es gibt alles auch zum Verschenken!

Wenn wir das Geld nicht zusammen bekommen, müssen wir uns entscheiden, welche der vielen, schönen Sachen wir produzieren können. Das wäre sehr schade...

Deshalb: helft mit, sichert Euch die tollen Weltraumsouvenirs! Und verbreitet die Nachricht!!


ENGLISH

All perks shown as a photo or design (if prototype not available yet) on www.kosmos-gesellschaft.org

Do you dream of outer space? Or know somebody who does? Then the Cosmos Society was made just for you! The Cosmos Society is a fictitious society founded by artist Christine Niehoff as an art project with the goal to create a real platform for all important questions about mankind in space, from the everyday to the totally crazy. Amy Alexander is also an artist and a real candidate for the Mars One Mission, the one-way mission to Mars!

We already have a great logo, but for the official launch of the society in Christine's solo show in Potsdam at the end of November we also need, as any proper society worth their while would, proper merchandise! And for that we need you! In return for your support you will be the very first with exclusive access to certificates, pens, mugs, bags and original prints! Every little help towards our seed capital is welcome! Everything is also available as a gift!

If we don't get the money together we will have to make some tough choices as to which of all the wonderful products we will be able to have made which would be a real pity....

story:
What is Gallery Aferro? What’s the big excitement?

Gallery Aferro is a Newark-based alternative arts space founded in 2003 by artists Evonne M. Davis and Emma Wilcox. We dream big: in 2014, we began an ambitious project to renovate two additional buildings adjacent to our current space into a single 90,000 sq ft cultural center, allowing us to have an even bigger, richer, and more lasting impact for our wonderful community. We believe in sharing ideas, sharing resources, and that everyone, every single person, should be able to have the arts in their lives and feel welcome at our space. Over the past 11 years, we've worked with hundreds of artists, welcomed thousands of visitors, and become an important part of our community.

The critical mass of many artists under one roof, and the consortium model we've created with our numerous partners and collaborators means that the project will be a beloved, iconic destination for youth, artists, families, and in short, everyone. The project includes numerous components: 60 artist studios, workshop/lab spaces for specific media like printmaking and commercial photo studio with a co-op, membership model, presenting spaces for visual arts and film, purpose-built educational space, fun retail like a cafe and an enlarged gift shop, and "flux spaces," designated in response to strong community demand for flexible spaces that can be used for conferencing, hackathons, skillshare sessions, yoga and dance classes, staged readings and poetry slams, etc.

We have almost everything we need to make that happen- but we’re asking for your support for the remaining funding to open in 2015.

We work very hard and do lots of cool stuff:

We are a DIY kind of place: we do all building repairs, hang the shows, locate and use recycled and donated materials, and work with a large group of community volunteers, including both of our moms. In 2006, the gallery was able to move into a donated 20,000 sq ft building right here in the heart of downtown Newark. Since then, we’ve steadily and rapidly developed all of the programs that we offer for residents of Newark and the greater region:

·  Our ambitious annual roster of 12-15 on-and off-site exhibitions, of local, national and international artists, in every contemporary media, FREE to see

·  A wide range of FREE public events such as artist talks, workshops, performances, panels, and screenings

·  Our year-round artist residency program, connecting artists who have ranged in age from 19 to 60+ with large studios, resources, and community

·  Educational offerings such as FREE tours for school/adult groups and our FREE arts/STEM intensive for Newark’s high school age women

·  Our new public art initiative, Activate: Market Street, bringing installation, new media and interactive art to multiple vacant storefronts on our block 24/7

·  Aferro Publications, consisting of more than 20 artist books, exhibition catalogs, essays, and a sound art CD, to date.

We have an excellent track record of collaboration with dozens of other galleries, museums, schools, grassroots collectives, social service orgs,and others. We are as comfortable working with a large museum as we are rigging up a projector to run off a car battery and sharing art in a vacant lot! We have been honored with 3 consecutive citations of excellence from the NJ state arts council, as well as with the ongoing everyday recognition of the numerous people who make us a part of their lives.

We are working harder, dreaming bigger, and doing more cool stuff for and with more people:

We seek to seize the opportunity presented by the vacant buildings, and contribute to positive momentum in Newark. We know we can serve our most vulnerable neighbors, as well as create a wonderful iconic destination that people from outside the area will want to visit! We want to create a positive model that can be leveraged to ensure that the arts stay accessible and centrally located as the city changes. Newark has an incredible history of cultural activity up to the present, but many residents still face numerous challenges. We want to be the the biggest and the best organization we can be to serve our community.

What we have: $50,000 in funds raised from individuals and foundation, $100,000+ in donated in-kind labor from contractors, architects, and community volunteers, and of course, the 70,000 sq ft in additional donated space from RBH Group. What we need: your support to cover the remaining funding gap in our budget for electrical upgrades, restroom renovation for wheelchair-accessible facilities, and fire safety needs, mainly new emergency doors and lighting/signage. The fact that we have been able to raise almost all of the funding and support to make the project happen speaks to the community desire for the expansion to open. We have always taken accountability and transparency seriously: we will keep everyone updated on what we’re doing and how we’re doing, and answer questions!

Yay perks! As you can see, we’ve got some awesome perks to thank you for your support. We commissioned Aferro-affiliated artists Jerry Gant, Wendy Letven, Fausto Sevilla, Elizabeth Storm and Joe Waks to create limited edition posters, lovingly printed to a high standard by family-owned local printer Remco Press. We were founded in Newark, we love doing what we do in Newark, and we want each of you who donates to feel that excitement. The posters and other perk items reflect our time and place, this moment of incredible possibility here in NJ’s largest city, the one and only Newark NJ.

How you can help: Donate here and now. Share the campaign online. Tell somebody about it. Tell everybody about it. Get coworkers or friends together to go in on a big perk and have a great private party! Write an article about the project. Get excited for 2015!

From all of us, thank you so very much for your interest, we hope you will check out our links, pictures, and get involved. We want to thank MEDINA=CITI our incredible neighbors who produced and edited our video, and our wonderful friends who appear in it.  #newarknj #aferroexpansion #galleryaferro #indiegogoperks

story:
The Show: Honey, it's the middle of nowhere Martin County and the high school science fair is in full gear with this years stakes higher than they probably should be. A Mexican psychic, a Memphis stripper, and the central mouthpiece for the local Baptist church all have sons competing, but when one of the sons is found to be a fruitcake, different beliefs lead us down a kooky path of good vs. evil. Half-ass drag,  half spoken word, and half hip-hop, Secret Science Fair is one hundred and fifty percent a bat-poop bananas show that looks at the place where American culture is formed: below the surface.  

When and Where is this Show: The Wild Project (in the ol' Village East; NYC). Thursday, January 7th and Friday, January 8th, 2016 at 7:30pm both nights.  

 

What We Needs and Why: First and foremost, your love. Secondly, you to come to see the show in January. BUT also, just a little bit of money. Farting in NYC is expensive  so producing a show can certainly can be a challenge but we love it. Rentals, costumes, tech folk and rehearsal space all beg for our coins and so we beg for your support. Your money assures that we pay every single person involved. We can't do it on our own and we're asking you, our friends, to help us get there. 

Artistic Team

Created and Performed by Brennan Vickery

Directed by Cassandra Paras

Stage Manager: Garrett Guilbeau

Sound Designer: Andy Evan Cohen 

Videography: Seth Braley

Dramaturg: Ryan Trout
story_txt: The Show: Honey, it's the middle of nowhere Martin County and the high school science fair is in full gear with this years stakes higher than they probably should be. A Mexican psychic, a Memphis stripper, and the central mouthpiece for the local Baptist church all have sons competing, but when one of the sons is found to be a fruitcake, different beliefs lead us down a kooky path of good vs. evil. Half-ass drag,  half spoken word, and half hip-hop, Secret Science Fair is one hundred and fifty percent a bat-poop bananas show that looks at the place where American culture is formed: below the surface.  When and Where is this Show: The Wild Project (in the ol' Village East; NYC). Thursday, January 7th and Friday, January 8th, 2016 at 7:30pm both nights.   What We Needs and Why: First and foremost, your love. Secondly, you to come to see the show in January. BUT also, just a little bit of money. Farting in NYC is expensive  so producing a show can certainly can be a challenge but we love it. Rentals, costumes, tech folk and rehearsal space all beg for our coins and so we beg for your support. Your money assures that we pay every single person involved. We can't do it on our own and we're asking you, our friends, to help us get there. Artistic TeamCreated and Performed by Brennan VickeryDirected by Cassandra ParasStage Manager: Garrett GuilbeauSound Designer: Andy Evan Cohen Videography: Seth BraleyDramaturg: Ryan Trout

story:
A FLASH ART SALE

Hi!  Britten Traughber here, also known as the Notorious BLT or Lady Bea Touble... for those of you who don't know me I'm an  artist/photographer/professor based in Normal IL. Recently I moved from the Big Island of Hawaii in order to continue teaching, while my husband Bert finishes his PhD research in Hawaii.   Hawaii was an adventure and challenge beyond what anyone could have prepared me for. I met so many great people, and one of my greatest joys of Island life was creating artwork showing the diversity and challenges of island life. I also got to experience being broke beyond broke- overeducated and underemployed- and living in a colonized land that should still be it's own country- hooray for the USA! 

One of many adventures in Hawaii, I had an opportunity to buy an Epson 7900 printer for a fraction of the normal cost. It was brand new, never opened, and worked like a charm after a little island-maintenance and TLC. I used it for a little over a year, printing images for friends, clients, the local theatre company, and many others. The joy of being able to make my own prints  again was immense, and completed the cycle of my personal practice as an artist. 

Now the time has come, after 4 years on the island and 6 months of living apart, for Bert to join me in Illinois! While we have been trying to manage the logistics of moving him back to the mainland, paying for 2 households, working 4 jobs, etc...  the ONE unanswered question has remained- What do you do with a 200 lb professional printer? We have tried to find a buyer on island, with no luck. And to be honest, the cost of shipping it still makes the investment an absolute steal. The worst case scenario is that we find no buyer, do not ship it, and it is left behind or put into storage. I am trying my hardest to avoid losing such a key piece of equipment! 

So... Instead of asking for donations (everyone needs donations, right? LOL) I am asking you to help me invest in my studio practice by BUYING MY ART. 


What We Need & What You Get


  • Bert has researched the cheapest methods of shipping the printer, and around $900 is the lowest we have been able to find from Hilo to Illinois. We spent a bit to build a sturdy crate, and the printer has been packed beautifully. Once sent, it will travel via ship and arrive in 8-12 weeks.
  • If we do not reach the whole goal, that's ok! Any amount raised will be put towards the shipping cost... Leaving it behind is not an option anymore! If we raise more, it will be applied towards the other expenses of getting Bert (and our pets) back to the Mainland. Worst case, I can leave the printer, but not my husband and cats. 
  • What do you get? YOU GET AWESOME ART! YOU CAN GIVE AWESOME ART FOR THE HOLIDAYS! YOU CAN BUY  DISCOUNT  SESSIONS WITH ME AND HAVE YOUR HOLIDAY SHOPPING DONE! 

Why is this important? 

In the grand scheme of things it's not. It's just stuff. You can't take it with you, right? I left a lot of material things to move to Hawaii, and I left a lot of material things there. But this is much more important than just a "thing". This is art!  
Those of you who know me, and follow my work, know I am a hardworking and resilient broad. My art is everything to me, and I am constantly working towards a more sustainable and successful professional practice. The sacrifices and challenges of living in Hawaii are going to take a while to counterbalance both personally and professionally, and being able to continue my own printing will be a key element to this transition. I have exhibits already booked for May and June in Illinois, and this is just the beginning of a new active presence in the world of photography. 
While most photographers do not own their own large scale printers, I bought it at such  low price that it just made sense to own one. I have shared my printer with students, printmakers, other photographers, and eventually I would love to have it become part of my Pipe Dream to build a community photo center and darkroom. There's no use in having such great equipment and keeping it to yourself! 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

 I want to include a little bit of everything in this sale- small prints, large prints, small sessions, large sessions... Fine art and my boobies. If there is something you would like to order that you don't see on the Perks, just contact me! If you are a past client, and want to order from a past session, just email me! 

All prints and gift certificates will be mailed the 1st week of December, if not sooner, in time for the holidays. All images will be signed! 

Thank you again!

Much Love! * Britten

story:
Short Description

I called my book Lark's Enchanted World because I love to live in the world where miracles are a reality. With your help this book will be printed and traverse the world so more people will believe in miracles and live in peace with each other.

It is a hardcover book with 62 complementary paintings and poems. I write and paint directly from my heart and each of my poems found a soulmate in one of my paintings.


Why Is Lark's Enchanted World Important?

I was delighted and then inspired to learn recently that science now recognizes what artists have long known: That art can be as powerful as love.

Case in point: Semir Zeki, Professor of Neuroaesthetics at University College London, found that blood flow to the brain “increased when looking at a beautiful painting just as it increases when you look at somebody you love. This tells us that art induces a feel-good sensation directly to the brain."

In non-scientific terms, Dr. Zeki is saying that the process of observing art connects those who observe with the artists, their art and their moments of inspiration. And like all artists, I want to share with you, through my art, the love that art can induce, and the healing it can bring.

I want readers to enjoy and share the love that art brings me. My creation process is very important in it: I meditate and allow my intuition to guide me. This helps me release stress, connect to my higher self and dive into a more pure consciousness. I believe my book will help readers experience the same elevated soul state.

The Vision

When I realized that there was healing energy in my poetry and paintings, I resolved to present them together to enhance and strengthen their impact. The latest result of these magic explorations is "Lark’s Enchanted World". It evokes the wild, beautiful surroundings where I grew up in rural Ukraine and the passionate beauty of nature of California, where I live now. 

Who Am I?

“I am rarely a “fan” of any artist, but Lark aka Larisa Pilinsky is an exceptional phenomenon. Besides her brilliant sense of composition, she is the ultimate “green artist” or maybe she is also the grand ‘love child’ of Kandinsky and Schwitters, but regardless I find Lark’s talent is built on the ‘shoulders’ of masters of the 20th century.” 
                  Tony Clark, Chévalier dans l'Ordre des Arts et des Lettres,
                  American Association Of Museum Directors Board Member.

I call myself Lark, I was born Larisa Leibman, the daughter of a geologist and a language teacher. I grew up in the world of their explorations and dreams, surrounded by his semi-precious stones and sounds of my mother voice, singing songs in different languages and reading me Shakespeare sonnets. They taught me how to become one with nature and learn from her, so that now nature heals me whenever I feel physical or emotional pain.

Through this book I hope to share these knowledge with you. Many of my artistic clients say they find joy, peace and healing in my work. Here are the words of just one of them:
“Lark, I lost my beloved husband of 54 years last Thanksgiving and your paintings give me such sublime peace. I love them. So happy to find your wonderful art that soothe me. Thank you Lark."
Linda Warwick Van Fossan

How You Can Help

Your contribution will fund a limited, signed edition of beautiful art treasures . I will supervise the quality of each volume before it is shipped, and inscribe it with a personal note according your wishes. The cost of printing 300 copies will be $5,200. 

Lark's Enchanted World will be just that: Enchanted! It will be a full color, 8.5" x 11" 124-page hardcover book which will consist of 62 paintings from my Conversations With Nature series and 62 of my poems from different periods which relate to each other.


What Will Lark's Enchanted World Look Like 

The first half of the book, titled Love Flowers, explores love, loss, and hope through atmospheric landscapes. Poems accompany each painting to bring out my vision and feelings for each piece. The Kiss Of The Sky is the second half, here I reflect on miracles, nature’s power and our place within the world. Both are infused with love for nature and all that is divine within us. 

Where The Money Will Go

Your pledge will help produce, print and ship 300 copies of my book, and spread the healing power of nature through my work. The members of my team are my  husband, Laurence Vittes, who is the inspiration, the editor of this book and the love of my life. Ms. Arzu Tunca, publisher,  was instrumental in the creation of this book and the Indiegogo campaign. She has collected and assembled the entire book and when funds are available, she will print it.

Perks

$12
 • An E-book version of Lark’s Enchanted World

$25
• A 2" x 3" original framed painting by Lark (see the samples below)
$25 includes shipping in the United States

story:
Intro to my campaign

I'm a portrait artist and I love what I do. I've been doing  this since I was a kid, but never thought of it as a profession I could take up. But I had to get real with myself and ask: 

"Am I fulfilled?"

And the answer was: NO

And I knew exactly what I am passionate about but had a lot of doubts, had heard all the old cliches about starving artists, not a proper way to make a living, and on, and on. 

So I removed the doubts, and the excuses.

And now I'm a portrait painter. I'm actually doing it. And I have a kid who already looks like she's an artist of some sort, and I don't want her to have to deal with the lack of support I experienced. But kids are wise, none of this "Do As I Say, Not What I Do" will wash with a kid. I will demonstrate to her that in this life, you follow your passion.


You get a pretty unique perk - there won't be another like it! And they make great gifts!

I'm offering artwork - specifically, a portrait of whoever you choose - yourself, a loved one, a hero. The perks start at 40$ and are all skilfully rendered in pencil, charcoal, watercolour or paint. They are unique, no other like it - and you can own one for yourself or offer as a gift!


The Impact

The funds I am raising will go towards the holding an exhibition - a one man show of my work. As an artist, you have to make those connections and put yourself out there and a one man show, and the marketing I will perform leading up to it, will really raise my profile and on the way to making a living from this full time. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just letting people know about this campaign will make a difference!

story:
My name is Monk e Burnswell and I have been building effigies for

the Mid-Atlantic burner community since 2004, and yearly since 2009.
Along with Hedy Sirico, I lead a crew of dedicated artists and
craftspeople that build some of the most inventive and beautiful
pyrotechnic bonfires in the Mid-Atlantic area.The HM Pyrotechnic team
have made 1000's smile.
    

    Our team has made an Astro-Bear fly across the lake into a spaceship.
The team has made a 12-foot high wooden Robot Bear walk and destroy
his lab. Last year, the team literally wrote a 10 foot high pop-up book
that burst into flames.

    We are about to embark on our 6th consecutive year of building to
burn. This season's festival cycle includes PEX Summerfest,
Fahrenheit, Freeform and Return to Roots. While we get funding from
each of these festivals to create their effigies, additional funding
will help us to create an even bigger and better show. With each
successive year we strive to add more sophistication and art to each
burn. We have raised the bar of expectations (both ours and our
audiences), higher with every fire we present.

    We are appealing to the community to help us continue taking
Fire Theater to the next level. We have always operated with the
spirit of "Your enjoyment is our satisfaction.”
Funds are needed for a research and development phase for new
pyro-kinetic elements, to secure a larger space for construction, as
well as to maintain our current material storage. Your donation will
further our explorations in the pyrotechnic arts.

     Every project we have produced has come from second use materials,
construction scrap and other discarded furniture, all gathered by us
from the streets and alleys of Philadelphia. While it cost us little
more than the effort it takes to gather it up, we do need to have a
place store it all. A portion of the monies we raise from this
campaign will go towards maintaining our year-round storage of
materials, as well as storing the necessary pyro equipment we use to
bring Fire Theater to the community. The remainder will be used to
purchase materials for research and development of kinetic
(pyro-powered) elements that we will incorporate into this year's
effigies.

    In addition to buttons, stickers, and t-shirts, we have some most unusual perks for our patrons: actual relics and significant elements from past fires (2010-2014) are available as our thank you for your support. Many are one-of-a-kind hand-crafted items. One generous donor can get a complimentary ticket to PEX Summer Festival, along with VIP front row seating, for them and a guest, with the effigy team during the burn, AND they get to PUSH THE BUTTON that ignites the fire. To view the perks click here.

   All funds will go towards research and development of pyro-kinetic
elements, as well as operating cost for constructing this year's
series of effigies.

   With your help we will be able to make the giant strides necessary
to continue to surprise the community. With your help we can continue
to grow as artists and maintain the tradition of bringing the audience
an experience they won't soon forget.


     My mentor in art school once told me “Most experiments fail, but if
you have learned something it’s a success." Over the years we have
included experimental elements in our effigies—some have succeeded and
others not so much. We will continue to include these in the future.
With your support we can perfect more of these elements in the
workshop instead of in the field and bring an even more polished
effort to the events on this year’s burn cycle.


Thank you for consideration. Please share this campaign far and wide,
even if you can't donate. With your help the HM Pyrotechnic Team will
be able to take it to the next level.
story_txt:
My name is Monk e Burnswell and I have been building effigies for
the Mid-Atlantic burner community since 2004, and yearly since 2009.Along with Hedy Sirico, I lead a crew of dedicated artists andcraftspeople that build some of the most inventive and beautifulpyrotechnic bonfires in the Mid-Atlantic area.The HM Pyrotechnic teamhave made 1000's smile.     
    Our team has made an Astro-Bear fly across the lake into a spaceship.The team has made a 12-foot high wooden Robot Bear walk and destroyhis lab. Last year, the team literally wrote a 10 foot high pop-up bookthat burst into flames.
    We are about to embark on our 6th consecutive year of building toburn. This season's festival cycle includes PEX Summerfest,Fahrenheit, Freeform and Return to Roots. While we get funding fromeach of these festivals to create their effigies, additional fundingwill help us to create an even bigger and better show. With eachsuccessive year we strive to add more sophistication and art to eachburn. We have raised the bar of expectations (both ours and ouraudiences), higher with every fire we present.
    We are appealing to the community to help us continue takingFire Theater to the next level. We have always operated with thespirit of "Your enjoyment is our satisfaction.”Funds are needed for a research and development phase for newpyro-kinetic elements, to secure a larger space for construction, aswell as to maintain our current material storage. Your donation willfurther our explorations in the pyrotechnic arts.     Every project we have produced has come from second use materials,construction scrap and other discarded furniture, all gathered by usfrom the streets and alleys of Philadelphia. While it cost us littlemore than the effort it takes to gather it up, we do need to have aplace store it all. A portion of the monies we raise from thiscampaign will go towards maintaining our year-round storage ofmaterials, as well as storing the necessary pyro equipment we use tobring Fire Theater to the community. The remainder will be used topurchase materials for research and development of kinetic(pyro-powered) elements that we will incorporate into this year'seffigies.
    In addition to buttons, stickers, and t-shirts, we have some most unusual perks for our patrons: actual relics and significant elements from past fires (2010-2014) are available as our thank you for your support. Many are one-of-a-kind hand-crafted items. One generous donor can get a complimentary ticket to PEX Summer Festival, along with VIP front row seating, for them and a guest, with the effigy team during the burn, AND they get to PUSH THE BUTTON that ignites the fire. To view the perks click here.
   All funds will go towards research and development of pyro-kineticelements, as well as operating cost for constructing this year'sseries of effigies.
   With your help we will be able to make the giant strides necessaryto continue to surprise the community. With your help we can continueto grow as artists and maintain the tradition of bringing the audiencean experience they won't soon forget.     My mentor in art school once told me “Most experiments fail, but ifyou have learned something it’s a success." Over the years we haveincluded experimental elements in our effigies—some have succeeded andothers not so much. We will continue to include these in the future.With your support we can perfect more of these elements in theworkshop instead of in the field and bring an even more polishedeffort to the events on this year’s burn cycle.Thank you for consideration. Please share this campaign far and wide,even if you can't donate. With your help the HM Pyrotechnic Team willbe able to take it to the next level.

story: Hello, My name is Keisha Williams. I am a self taught painter from Brooklyn, New York. I started painting in 2010 and it was just a hobby but now I found my calling. Painting is my life and I love it but art supplies are pretty expensive. My goal is to produce more paintings so I can attend more events and network with my fellow artists. My future goals is to open my own art gallery/cafe so other artists can get exposure. Thank you so much!!!

story:
ABOUT THE ARTIST:

Fine artist Karen Y. Buster was invited to share her talents abroad with Artists 2 Africa, participating as a teacher on this tour representing her discipline of graphic design. She is one of several artists throughout the U.S. invited to teach other creative mediums including: Carren Clarke-Mcadoo (VA), Shurvon Haynes (WA), Jolyn E. Gardner (WA), Larry Poncho Brown (MD), Tommy Roberts (MD), Shawn Livers (MD), and Ethan Holland (PA), to name a few. A noteworthy group of American artists exchanging creative education with African artists!

ABOUT A2A:

ARTISTS 2 AFRICA was birthed from decades of artists discussing the prospect of organizing a group journey to Africa tailored specifically for artists and focused on art education. On October 19-30, 2013 we will embark on our second official journey to Ghana West Africa!

The artists will journey into the art villages on the outskirts of Ghana. Various artisans including painters, sculptors, and weavers will be gathered in their workshops to create and collaborate. We will fellowship with the artists and students, visit their workshops to share technique, and explore the creative process, while exchanging our creative ideas with the artisans in the region. An exhibition will be organized featuring the works of each artist. Our focus is to educate and connect through ART.

HOW WILL YOUR FUNDS BE UTILIZED?

With your support we hope you will assist us with this unified effort. As you can see on the right...the artist has graciously donated her art for perks. The campaign is to assist us with acquiring art materials for other artists to use on our visit as we fellowship by creating art. We will be visiting 4 locations where ceramic, wood carving, fabric making and other artforms are taught and produced. We will introduce various art projects and will instruct several groups of artisans and other participants. Funds will assist with art supplies and materials, and small tools. We also plan to document this experience with photography and video as a future educational medium. We hope you will take advantage of this unique opportunity to assist with this project....thank you. Share.Teach.Create!
